I figured I would try it because new things are added automatically with updates and I just hoped that would be one of the things added.

Alexa can hear me from almost anywhere in my townhouse. I'm just beginning to explore alll the features, but Alexa's speech recognition ability is phenomenal. So far I use it mostly for background music. I am a theater sound enthusiast, and although the sound of the Echo is amazing for its size, it can't replace a real hifi system, but I didn't expect that. For what it is, it's awesome. Amazing bass in such a small package. I'm tempted to add another Echo for stereo sound. Just started using a smart plug. Very nice. I can control it from the iPhone app also. I'm upgrading my set-top boxes to be echo-compatible and I'm looking forward to having Alexa help me find the programs I want on cable TV. Verizon's search system is pretty cumbersome. Get it for the music, play with the other features. Oh, and I like Amazon music. Alexa can find music in categories, or by certain artists, and by many other criteria that I have yet to discover.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good sound quality, straightforward installation, but a little clumsy at first to command.
reviews.reviewText: I have used Echo for years, and more recently the Sonus version of Alexa as well. I really like this unit, with only one exception: when I first went to call up my Amazon playlist, it took a while to be able to find it on the phone app I had downloaded. It was not intuitive (to me, at least) and required some hunting before I finally got it. (Of course, my sons would suggest that this was operator error, not a problem with the app, but I would rather take the position that if you are going to market these gadgets to old people like me, then you should spell out how to find your music rather than make it a treasure hunt.) Overall, a very good product thus far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Expensive toy with few uses unless you spend more $$$$
reviews.reviewText:
Don't believe all the claims of everything the Echo will do. I bought this Echo plus to connect with my TV mainly. Everything it can do sounded pretty cool. Unfortunately, after MUCH research and many failed attempts, the Echo will not connect with my TV unless I buy either another TV or a hub. Playing Amazon through my TV speakers? No, not without a hub. I can "launch" Netflix, but if you have SlingTV, Echo doesn't do much. Want to turn on lights? Buy more equipment. Controlling the lights (thru the electrical socket, not Alexa enabled lightbulbs) from your Alexa app on your cell phone? I haven't tried that yet, but some reviews have said that you may need to buy a hub.

Echo will search Prime Video and Amazon Music, it will set an alarm, it will answer some questions, but expect to expend more $$$$ if you want to automate your home and/or entertainment system.

I have had every generation of Echo's this is an improvement over the last version but there's still a lack with the voice recognition. Sometimes it turns the mic on randomly and sometimes I have to repeat myself multiple times for Alexa to do what I want. The sound quality is a lot better. I play music on all my Echos when I listen to music and this can get louder, play more bass and clearer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for sound but Alexa needs improvement
reviews.reviewText:
Honestly I bought this over the google home because from what I could tell the sound is much better but that shows in the price difference but I’m honestly dissapointed in Alexa’s cabilitys and how many times she gets things wrong while google home gets it right , for example google will allow you to continue a conversation while Alexa resets every time so if you wanted to change a light to a color and change the brightness you would have to do with separate commands but as far as sound it’s pretty loud and clear and there is a bit of bass .
Pros - good sounds
Looks very clean
Is compatible with many products
Cons - Alexa needs a lot of improvement which could be fixed over updates
Even though there is serval mics sometimes she Doesent respond to you
Actions are a big sluggish and take time

I replaced my 1st generation with this unit. The sound is better, a lot. However, it doesn't recognize my WiFi plug. It seems to have better sound sensitivity. Other than that, it is still the same.

Suggestions to Amazon: Offer a male or female voice to make it more understandable. Slow the rate of speech for hard of hearing. Bring back the volume ring and allow the volume to be more finely adjusted rather than 10% increments. It's still not very smart when asked questions. Is anyone paying attention to its knowledge resource?

My advice is to go for the 3rd generation and skip the 2nd.

The audio quality is great. We got an Echo as a Christmas gift, and use it in our family room for music. Honestly, it is a novelty, and I would never have considered getting one for myself. HOWEVER, I was subsequently fascinated by the Echo Plus promotion, with the free Phillips bulb, and did purchase one myself for use upstairs in our master bedroom. I use it to play music, but very much enjoy the ability to control the lamp on the nightstand with my voice. Nothing like not having to turn the light off BEFORE getting into bed (lol). It was a very simple installation. UNFORTUNATELY, I did not order my Echo Plus quick enough before the after holiday price increased from 119.99 to 149.99. Oh well, but I am not sorry I bought it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not quite ready for prime time...
reviews.reviewText: I bought the 3 piece bundle and here are my thoughts. The sound is decent (although overpriced) for what it is. It really needs decent bass, however, the Amazon "sub" is a terrible option (it's really a midrange speaker trying to push low end sound). Unless you're playing pop/dance music the sound becomes muddy. There's about a one or two second delay between the speakers when giving a command. In other words, the Echo Plus that is closest to you will listen to your command while the other Echo and Sub will continue playing music for a second or two. Bottom line... this just isn't worth the price Amazon is asking... less than half, actually. I'm returning this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish I had invested in the Sonos One speakers
reviews.reviewText:
Let's start with the positive.
Sound quality (I have two linked as stereo pair) is fair to good for their size. The microphone is very sensitive and can hear a voice in another room. Speakers look good and fit easily on the counter.
Why I gave it only 3 stars.
The Pandora station(s) continually just stop (and I have Pandora as the default channel) for no reason. Or one speaker stops and the other plays. Alexa app not the easiest to use. Controlling the volume with the app is near impossible. Voice commands can be tricky! Buttons on top could be bigger and with brighter/better markings.

These are amazing devices with great sound quality. I bought two to pair with an Echo Sub Woofer and am blown away with the performance. My Echo Dot's are great but the Plus takes my Alexa eco system to the next level. They are hub capable but my Show handles that duty but it's nice to have the capability in case I move things around in the future. There's definitely more capabilities for me to learn but I'm very happy with this purchase. I really like the look and feel of the gen2 compared to gen1. The gen2's look high end compared to the gen1 plastic cylinder. The hardest decision for me was what color to pick but I'm pretty happy with charcoal. I think the darker color will wear better over time and it blends in better with our dark entertainment system components.

Not very impressed with Amazon right now. I purchased the new Echo Plus as an upgrade to our 1st generation Echo. I was interested in the Home Hub option and the better sound quality was definitely a plus. I happened to be on Amazon just a few days after I ordered the new unit and I saw that it had gone on sale for a lower price. What I came to find out is that Amazon does not offer price match on items purchased. I spoke to a rep on the chat line and they said, while they don't price match, you can return the Echo and order a new one at the lower price. This is ridiculous... Amazon basically pays for twice the shipping (returning the old unit and shipping the new one), rather than a simple adjustment to the payment method that was originally tendered. I would understand if the price went down and I didn't notice until after it was too late to request a partial refund, but 4 days?!?!?! Come on!! Jeff Bezos... not a good choice for customer retention.

reviews.reviewTitle: Less than ideal whole house sound system
reviews.reviewText: I bought these to start setting up a whole house audio system and not for the Alexa features so my review reflects that. I have built in whole house sound in my current home and am moving to a new home without it so planning on going wireless and don't want to break the budget. Th sound quality of the Echo Plus is OK, especially when configured into a stereo pair, but just OK and definitely bellow the quality of my built in system powered by a Sony A/V receiver. I could probably live with the sound quality for ambient music, but the real deal killer is that in multi speaker WiFi mode the Echo can only be paired to ONE Spotify account. This is a huge gap since my wife, daughter and I all have our own accounts, music tastes and stored playlists. I am going to try the Sonos Play:1 and see if that provides a better experience. If you only have one Spotify account in the house the Echo Plus could make a whole house sound system.

The sound isn't noticeably better than the other 2nd gen and more importantly the hub is useless! I bought a Samsung smartthings water leak sensor and a door sensor. The door sensor works great but apparently the water leak sensor won't work without the smart things hub! I had to dig around for hours on Amazon and Samsung forums to find out it won't work! Why am I paying more money for a (premium echo) if I need to buy a hub to do what I need it to do? This is a complete rip off!

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound is good! Would be nice if it had zigbee and zwave.
reviews.reviewText: Works great as advertised. Looks great. Good sound. Not perfect yet! Only wish is it had both zigbee and zwave. It would be nice if Amazon would fix it so when you have 2 hooked up together both speakers would work together all the time. Right now the only time both speakers work in stereo is for music. Any other time the 2nd speakers is only sitting doing nothing. Amazon needs to fix that and add zigbee to the hub. Then it would be perfect. I gave it 4 stars becasue of those issues.
This echo is exactly what I was expecting.

reviews.reviewTitle: When devices and Alexa do what they are supposed to...
reviews.reviewText:
The devices and the Alexa app seem to get confused in any configuration that isn’t absolutely simplified. Example: stereo configurations create systemic confusion between two units that are both listening and trying to respond appropriately. And once they become confounded their cloudy “thinking” just piles on and they become inert. Second example: multiple room groups also cause competing responses. Last example: I have not figured this one out yet but the Alexa app has a bug that has actually reactivated Amazon Music after I stopped playing music and had closed the app. This became a problem when after closing Amazon Music and trying to play Pandora, Alexa jumped back in (even though it was closed) and restarted Amazon Music and didn’t let me stream Pandora from the same iPad.

I’ve had two Echo Plusses replaced - and this was recommended by an Amazon service person who said it was a software glitch.

Last note: the new units worked perfectly for 4 weeks then started doing the same thing; however, 10 days later they were perfect again and are still working great. (Was a software fix pushed to my new units?)

I have had the echo dots in every room of the house. My son wanted to get this for the kitchen. The sound is awesome! I’m very happy with it. Actually, (no idea why) I didn’t even have to set it up. I turned it on and opened my Alexa app and it automatically added itself. The damnedest thing. Anyhoo, really cool. Linked up with all my other items except the Fire TV. That thing won’t link with anything. 😡

I wanted this echo plus for my parent's in law. They recently renovated their house and bought wifi dimmers. They wanted to be able to control their lights with Alexa. If you install wifi dimmers, you need a smart things hub as well, that will connect to Alexa (I did not originally know that as I thought this hub would work). Once I bought the second hub I was easily able to connect everything. They have a few Alexas devices in their house and they can basically control their lights from anywhere in the house. They also this echo plus to listen to music while they are at home and they love the sound quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa doesn't speak indoor temperature, Most disappointed!
reviews.reviewText:
Hello All,

I received my Echo Plus on October 7th. It was so easy to set up for the most part. I plugged it in and in a few short minutes, it was online ready to play! The sound for its small size was awesome~! I wouldn't think one would want much more than that right? I purchased this unit since I wanted Alexa to speak the indoor temperature. I tried saying or doing a number of things but the indoor temperature eluded me. I imagined having a device which wouldn't need outdoor wired or wireless probes with batteries. I would already have accurate outdoor temperature info as well as the indoor temperature and no need for probes of any kind. I think I spent hours trying to get the indoor temperature to speak with Alexa. I could go into the Alexa App select the echo plus and read the indoor temperature through my phone, So why couldn't she speak the indoor temperature! I learned later that a sensor had to be activated. It's a shame that Alexa couldn't have activated the Sensor. An Amazon help person tried to tell me what I needed to find but I think I was dealing with graphics. I am totally blind and use voiceover on my IPhone. I couldn't find the sensor or anything else to activate the indoor temperature so it would speak. I watched some youtube videos but none of these helped. Perhaps I'll approach disability services to see if they know of a solution to this! I deregistered the echo plus from my account and put it back in the box. If I can't find any solution for finding the sensor and turning on the indoor temperature, the echo plus is heading back to Amazon. I'll stay with my tried and true echos.

Jim

I am happy to say that I didn’t send my Echo plus back after all! I removed it from its box before registering to my account again! At first, I couldn’t see the indoor temperature on my phone. I planned to call disability services. Four hours later, I checked my phone after selecting the Echo Plus and saw the indoor temperature again! I thought I’d get brave and ask Alexa to give me the inside temperature. I said, echo, temperature inside! She spoke it to my relief! I also said, Echo, inside temperature. She repeated it again! I was pleased! Something may not have been right in the first registration or I wasn’t giving her the right verbage! I don’t know what happened for certain! I didn’t have to activate anything! It worked right away! I didn’t call disability services. My wife has ordered another one which will be used upstairs!

Long live the echo plus! Hope this or another generation of the echo plus with built on in hub will be available for a long time! The indoor temperature is an excellent feature!

Jim

reviews.reviewTitle: A great device, but there’s a problem...
reviews.reviewText:
Let me start by saying that I have several echo devices in my home, and really, I love them. It’s great to be able to turn lights on and off by command, to play games, stream music, and do so many other things with these devices. I’m hooked.

There is one major problem, though. When I first bought my echo plus speakers, things were great. About 2-3 days later, I linked my speakers together and gave Alexa a command to stop playing the music. She hesitated, but followed through. About a week later when I gave Alexa a command to end the music, she hesitated and then kept playing the music. Um, hello, who’s in charge here? So I gave the command again, louder. Same response from Alexa. I thought, “Dang, this girl likes her tunes!” It wasn’t until I walked over to my speaker in the family room and gave the command to stop the music that the music finally stopped. Had this not happened 3 separate times, I wouldn’t bother writing about it. What’s the point in all of these microphones on this device if Alexa’s just going to ignore me and jam out to Lithium XM anyway?

If this stops being an issue, I will update my review and give a 5 star rating. Right now, though, Alexa is kind of moody.

I have 4 original Echo, a 2nd gen Dot and a 3rd gen Dot, I love me some Echo's! This Echo Plus (2nd Gen) has amazing sound compared to all the others. I really like the deeper and richer bass, and overall better sound quality than my original Echo's. I actually have the Echo Plus (2nd Gen) in the bathroom, so that I can play music and and ask questions while in the shower. No problem with Alexa hearing over the shower, and I can hear everything clearly as well. I plan to slowly upgrade my original 4 Echo's to the new Echo Plus (2nd Gen), as I really like the sound quality, and also option to connect the Echo Sub.

reviews.reviewTitle: Versatile, high quality and reasonably priced
reviews.reviewText: We are “Apple” people with iPhones, iPads, iWatches and a HomePod. I purchased the Echo 2+ because I was curious. The HomePod has limited scope, and I think that Apple is only interested in pushing an iTunes subscription. Anyway, I set up the Echo in our bedroom. The app is user friendly and I was able to program it to wake us in the AM with a Snow Petrol song and give us a “flash briefing” from several news sources, both liberal and conservative. Then it gives us a weather forecast, and our calendar for the day as taken from our iPhone. Finally, we get the weather in our backyard from a WeatherFlow probe ( sold separately). The sound is also equivalent to the HomePod to my amateur ears. A real Winner

reviews.reviewTitle: So easy to set up and use. Decent sound quality.
reviews.reviewText:
So easy to set up. I have 3 Echo plus and 2 Echo dots with multi room speakers set up. Living in an apartment, I’m cognizant of neighbors and noise levels. With lots of these dotted around, (pardon the pun) I get good quality sound without having to crank up volume.

The speakers are pretty good for this price range and at lower volumes. While they don’t come with an equalizer, 3 sliders control bass, mid range and treble. Naturally you won’t get bottom range frequencies.

And it’s all voice controlled. Yes I know the arguments against having devices communicating your actions to a remote server and reliance on the same. But this is on a dedicated network just for lights and music. I don’t care if that’s logged.

Received this as a christmas gift. Never would buy this for myself! If you are tech savy and want to do setups fast, this is not for you. Some parts are frustrating, such as delecting the location of your place of employment. There is no delet function. And it will not get driving conditions on the 511PA.com site. Can’t find a way to get driving conditions anyway. Amazon keeps sending emails telling what yo can ask for, bucause it is not always so obvious. Also, this is absolutely not premium sound. They think very bassy is premium! And the equalizer controls are only somewhat useful. Difficult to get amazon purchaseed music from my wife’s account with her as a household member. Still figuring it out. Worese yet, this know it all device does not know how to give you instructions. Why can it now read its own manual to you? Ok, it does not have one because it is so intuitive! This device and its inktegration into a person’s life it clearly just a beginning. Wait for generation 10 to buy.

I love the sound quality of this speaker! I have it paired with a dot and have ordered another dot to complete my downstairs sound system. I no longer have to listen to the morning news radio on an old noisy am radio...what a relief to my ears!
I was a little surprised by my difficulty pairing the two and I’m tech savvy. But once I figured it all out, I now have to remind myself how Alexa thinks. Because I work with children I’m doing ok with that, but my wife is struggling. I’m hopeful Alexa will continue to learn, as Amazon claims. All in all, I love her, I mean It.
I think for lonely people, this might be a nice companion. Have you seen the movie about the guy who falls in love with his computer?

I like the lower profile compared to the original Echo which has been relocated downstairs. With the lower profile comes the ability to locate it in more places than before. The improved richness of the sound from the Echo is noticeable compared to the original. We got the light gray fabric outer covering and it is a softer look in the room. We have enjoyed using the whisper mode when appropriate...what a great improvement to the Echo experience. We have not tried the smart home hub since we have a Phillips Hue hub.

reviews.reviewTitle: What? no stereo for MyMedia h
reviews.reviewText: I bought my wife a set + woofer for xmas. Was impressive... at the time... Bought one for my office and was going to run the audio out into my amplifier but decided to get another Echo + woofer after I found out that all audio gets rerouted so I would always need to have my amp powered up. After I synced the new echo plus up, I found out stereo works only with Amazon allowed services. MyMedia comes out of only one speaker. Very disappointing. The one thing I bought this for is limited use. I can't see paying $9 a month for music. An Amazon rep called and will be getting back to me on what they find out.

This is my second Echo device. I bought a Dot last fall, when it was on sale; I was skeptical but curious. Much to my surprise, I found it to be both useful and fun, and quickly got used to having it as an integral part of the household.

However, even though my living space isn't huge, I found myself having to shout at times or being misunderstood. Given my success with the Dot, I thought I'd try installing the Echo Plus as my primary device for most of my household tech, and moving the Dot into the bedroom.

I was a little worried I'd have to reprogram everything to link it to the Echo Plus instead of the Dot, but it turned out to be a completely seamless process. My wall clock, Logitech and Philips Hue hubs all integrated perfectly with the new device, which offers much better sound quality as a bonus, and the Dot was perfect in the bedroom.

The Echo system isn't yet perfect, but new skills are being added all the time, and despite my initial skepticism I'm eager to see how it develops.

Love this speaker. I am very picky about sound quality which kept me from buying the first gen Echo. I thought the sound was too tinny. The Echo Plus sound is REALLY GOOD with nice bass and sound balance. Aesthetically pleasing also and the mic is very sensitive, picking up my voice easily even to almost a whisper. It's not a Bose, of course but for a portable speaker this is REALLY good. I may get 2-4 more for the rest of the house.

For those of you worried about smart home privacy, the Echo will not unlock doors or disarm a system. Lock / arm only which I appreciate.

The only thing I wish it had is a rechargeable battery so I could take it anywhere in the house more easily but for now I'll deal with the plug. Hope the 3rd gen comes with a battery. Suggestion, Amazon :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Great at first..a little disappointing now.
reviews.reviewText:
I was super excited to finally have an Alexa. After having her for months, I wouldn’t recommend her to anyone. Below are my pros and cons:

Pros- (1) Great speaker, (2) compatible with many devices, and (3) Alexa is easier to use and smarter than Siri.

Cons- (1) Doesn’t work well all the time. I have to repeat myself or reword commands. (2) Alexa’s abilities do not come already enabled. For example you want to play a game, you have to enable it on your app. (3) Compatibility with Hue lights isn’t the best. When asked to turn on “kitchen lights,” sometimes she will only turn 1 of 2 on. This sometimes requires you to reconnect the lights on your app.

In the end, Alexa is cool to have but not worth the money.

Wrote this review already for the echo dots and not usually a reviewer but I feel the need to steer people away from these so here is my review for all alexa devices. This thing is a straight up dumpster fire. Worked fine for a few weeks but now it wont play music. Repeatedly says it cant connect to internet and no matter what you tell it to play, it plays something different. In app connection trying to resolve issues is just as worthless. Attempting to play music from the app always comes back "unavailable at this time" and the voice recognition is shotty as best. Avoid these things at all cost because they are not worth the investment. Will be trying out a google device after this colossal failure of a purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Misleading pages: Doesn't work with Samsung water leak sensor
reviews.reviewText: I bought the Echo Plus and the new generation of Samsung water leak sensor thinking that these would pair. The Echo Plus page says it supports zigbee and the Samsung page says it supports Alexa. But Echo Plus could not detect the device. Samsung tech support said I needed to contact Amazon. Amazon support said Echo Plus supports some Samsung smart products but not the sensors. So now I need to buy the Samsung hub so what was the point of even having the hub built into Echo Plus. Both Amazon pages should be updated to be accurate.

reviews.reviewTitle: Would have been a five star BUT!
reviews.reviewText: Great sound. Works well paired with a second"Plus" and the sub woofer BUT....It came as a surprise to me that it does not work with my TV or the Fire Cube. Not a substitute for my sound bar.

My wife really enjoys this latest version of Alexa. There are a lot of various apps (otherwise known as skills in amazon Alexa talk) that are available. There is also an open source code available off-site that if you have a little bit of computer knowledge enables you to write a new APP (Skill) for your own specific use or purpose. Alexa needs to be connected to Wi-Fi to work any skills that are not based inside the home such as the Latest news, weather or sports but when the internet is down it can still tell you the current time and turn on/off various items if used with any additional outlet plugs and other such things.

We were impressed with the sound quality of the Echo Plus, but there was more. My husband is deaf in one ear, which makes it nearly impossible for him to locate the source of sounds. He's been unable to enjoy stereo/surround audio playback since the late 70's. BUT, the Echo's sound fills the room so that all the sound is all around. The traveling and directional effects of surround are not there for him, but he can hear it all. We had Alexa play some old Jimi Hendrix favorites because those recordings were state-of-the-art for stereo play in their day. The way the Echo translates those effects is the next best thing to having his left ear back!

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is deaf or senile most of the time
reviews.reviewText: Echo Plus 2nd gen is deaf most of the time. Her hearing is good as long as there are no other sounds in surrounding rooms. Not immediate area, BUT ROOMS! This echo is in my living room, as is my tv. If the tv is even very low,, she doesn't hear me unless i repeat and shout, and Ann standing 6" Frim her. If I have my family room dot playing softly 2 rooms away, the echo doesn't hear me. This is extremely frustrating, as I thought the2nd generation echo plus was supposed to have superior listening capabilities. My original echo was much better. I'm very disappointed

We have several echo dots now, and decided to get the echo plus. This thing is WORTH it! If you think the echo dots have good sound quality, you can literally multiply that sound quality by three, and that is how good the plus sounds. It's about the size of three echo dots stacked on top of one another. And the bass rattles my floors. Buy this thing, and make your life so much better. Plus it has a hub in it, saving you tons of money down the road for all your other devices, such as lights and smart plugs.
Edit: No, seriously, I am blown away by the speaker on this thing. I cannot stress enough how amazing this little thing is, it puts out the same amount of awesome sound you can get from a set of really good computer speakers. The bass and everything is just so great!! It's rattling my walls, floors, and couch. I mean, this thing ROCKS!!

I bought this as a replacement for a echo dot and the change was great, all was better from the other one and the build quality is really good if feels well done when you take out of the box. The setup was nothing almost didn’t by itself. And I have it tied to my phone and my Apple TV sound and I really enjoy it. Also dowloaded the skill for Apple Music and it’s great my family is having fun. Plus all in Spanish that is better yet . Sound quality I facile it 4 stars because I have wanted to change the audio when playing tv shows and the equalizer is bad. It should have something to play with modes like, sports, movie, and such. All phones have it, I would think it is a small step for this type of speaker.

This product fell short of my expectations . I’m sure at some point the technology will be there but it’s not quite there yet. I couldn’t set up something as simple as an alarm from one of my playlists. Tech-support was of no use as the thick accent was hard to understand . As of now all it does is play music for us. I should’ve bought a radio instead ...

reviews.reviewTitle: Not happy with echo plus 2nd gen.
reviews.reviewText: I have a 3rd gen echo dot that is awesome! I purchased what I thought was going to be an upgrade actually has more issues than my dot. This echo plus 2nd gen has 7 mics but doesn't hear you as well as the dot 3rd gen. You have to scream in order for it to hear you. Also, I experienced multiple issues where the device won't respond to the alexa app. Sound quality increased slightly over the echo dot but not enough to justify the price tag. The speaker still lacks bass. I highly recommend the echo dot 3rd gen but I can't recommend the echo plus 2nd gen because of price.

I returned this item. I was not impressed at all. It needs more intelligence. It didn’t offer much more than playing music, telling the weather and time. I have the dot for 30 bucks and it does the same. I was to keep but I couldn’t justify spending $150 for a glorified alarm clock.

I wish there was a phone app that came with Echo so I could click on my favorite apps or turn up up the volume. I cannot stand having to yell at this thing. It's turned into a hostile relationship. Try asking it to read something and you'll get an offer for a free audible trial, and then you have to yell to interrupt it while it's giving you the rundown. I've tried saying, "Alexa, do not ever use the Audible skill," but no use. At least once a week it happens again. And if I walk into the room with my laptop then Alexa announces that I'm connected, and when I leave the room it announces that I'm disconnected. It's really annoying. I do not like this voice control.

Ok, this section is new. I decided not to edit my original complaints but to add to them instead. I got a call from a friendly Amazon guy today who told me that there is, indeed, an Alexa app for my phone. And he even walked me through the app and showed me where to change the volume, select from my radio station history or from new stations, and a number of other things. I was familiar with the Alexa app on my laptop and it did not have any of these features, and I assumed the two apps were similar, but not so. (You know what they say about assuming.) Anyway, the guy was very helpful and I've since apologized to Alexa for my recent verbal abuse. Bottom line, this really is a good product. My two sons want one now. Sound quality is great, and guess what, the phone app has an eq so you can adjust the bass, mids, and treble. Who would have thunk?

This is our very first virtual assistant and we love it. We had no idea what we were doing with this type of technology but we can sincerely say it was easy to setup and also easy to add lights and plugs to it. We are really having lots of fun learning how to use it to its full potential and also how to ask it questions properly. There have been no issues with it not being able to hear us and respond back and its speaker is nice and loud if that's what you want. So far it has been a pleasure to have and we feel so updated and modern now lol. Honestly no regrets!

reviews.reviewTitle: My third "Echo device" is the 2nd generation Echo Plus and I'm very happy with it.
reviews.reviewText:
Silly me, I live in 645 sq ft and have three devices: a dot by my bed, an Echo 2nd generation on my kitchen counter, and a 1st generation on my art table. The distance from the last two is about 20 feet. Totally unnecessary, but one was a gift. I like asking what time is it, what is the weather, what do certain words mean, when is the next Seahawks football game, and listen to public radio. When I'm next door with a friend we like to ask questions such as how old was JFK when he ran for the Presidency. I listen to the dot as I fall to sleep, or when I'm doing jig saw puzzles on my iPad.

Color me techno grannie.

reviews.reviewTitle: nice gadget but useless for me
reviews.reviewText:
I fell for the hype about smart speakers and regret buying it for several reasons.
a) I don't have electrical consumers or controllers with WiFi capability, which comes at a hefty mark-up, for example installation of an AC thermostat with WiFi was offered to me for $350, while a normal one would be $150.
b) Alexa does not understand complex questions or words.
c) I have not found out how to tick of selected items from the shopping list (ok small issue).
d) I like to listen to music but Amazon only offers mainstream, or obviously my music taste is too extravagant. So I have I listen to my music using my smart phone which I connect the Echo (this works well).
The only other use I have for the Echo is asking for the temperature. And I really don't care about Alexa telling me jokes. So all in all, a waste of money.

My only problem is I had an echo dot, 1st generation, I signed up for the unlimited Amazon Music so we could play anything we wanted. I moved the dot downstairs and placed the Echo Plus upstairs. They do not link to take advantage of the unlimited music. I thought, fine I will move the account to the other device, but cannot find out how. The only thing I could find online was needing to call Amazon! - Really?

I bought the echo plus because of the pairing capability. I have 3 older Echo devices already and the sound quality is amazing. SO I figured the new devices had to be even better. I was correct.

I got them and added them to my network. Pairing them was easy and the sound quality was incredible. It has High-quality clarity and sound with rich bass. You will not be mad at this purchase...In fact, I am ordering the subwoofer asap. you don't really need it, but I would like to see what that sounds like.

I have used the Echo Dot in the past and found it handy for all sorts of information. That being said, I heard that the Echo Plus had good sound quality, so I bought one. I took it home, connected it to my Amazon music account. The sound was full and rich, nicely balanced, I immediately bought another Echo Plus and configured both for stereo. Excellent stereo with amazing depth and spaciousness. That left just one more thing to make a complete compact music system, a subwoofer! What luck, Amazon makes a matching subwoofer for the pair of Echo Pluses.
So, not only do I have the versatility that the Echo brings to the table, but now I have a near audiophile sound system. Bravo Amazon! Nice going, I'm a happy camper.

I upgraded from the original echo and bought two of these and the sub woofer for my bedroom, pairing all three together for stereo sound. The result is great. Amazon has done a great job making complex IOT setup very easy. Lights, thermostats, and Alexa devices pretty much set themselves up these days. The sound is great now.

reviews.reviewTitle: No music from phone play support yet, just Amazon music like services.
reviews.reviewText:
I reviewed the subwoofer but this came with it so I'll review it too.

Sound is much better then the dot. Recognition too.

Only thing I wish is for music that u own on my phone to be able to be played through paired speakers. Not just the Amazon music services like that. If there is a way, I cant figure it out. For such expensive speaker bundles, nonreason but $ that you cant allow/ do that. Other less expensive speaker work just fine playing any music you want through them.

They do sound great though and work with Alexa just fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Plus Works Grest with Echo Sub
reviews.reviewText: I really love the New Eco Plus (2nd Gen) as I knew I would as I already had an Echo (1st Gen), but giving it to a friend. I bought 2 Echo Pluses and the new Echo Sub. So now the Echo Pluses play in stereo and the Echo Sub adds a lot more base. Don't quite match my Klipsch speakers, but then they cost a lot less. Of course, I love that I can have Alexa play any music that I want upstairs in my computer room, wish my Klipsch system was tied into Alexa, but alas it is not.

reviews.reviewTitle: HORRIBLE Customer Service- Purchase from Best Buy or Target
reviews.reviewText:
I have been an Amazon Prime enthusiast for 4 plus years but am done. I am completely astonished with their customer service practices. If you are considering purchasing this item, I would think twice. If you are set on purchasing...BUY FROM BEST BUY OR TARGET...they have much better customer service!

I order this item as part of the Prime Day deals which made it $50 off. In addition, I order quite a few accessories to connect with the device in hopes of getting my whole house all connected. When the box arrived, this item was missing even though it was listed under the tracking number. I immediately called Amazon and was told that they would have to open an investigation to ensure that I wasn't lying and it would be a few days. I explained that I had pictures of the box and items that did arrive and that the box that arrived wasn't even close to big enough to fit the missing item so there was no way it could have been packaged. She did not care and did not want the photos. I was beyond annoyed because I was excited to get all my new gadgets setup. I contacted customer service again after the weekend and kept getting the run around. They ask if I wanted a refund and I said no, I want a replacement so I can get the sale price. They ignored my wishes and issued a refund. I contacted them numerous times after to which they completely ignored me. Once I finally got to speak to someone again I was told this cannot be escalated further, they cannot reverse the refund and that the original price I purchased for cannot be honored. Basically, no solution...I am just out of luck. This is a mistake 100% on Amazon and they are willing to do absolutely nothing to fix it. I now have to spend more of my time boxing up and returning all the devices I purchased to accompany this one. This whole situation is BEYOND frustrating and unacceptable customer service practices. I purchased this item because I was looking for an alternative to Apple...this is not the answer. If you are set on the Echo products, buy from Best Buy or Target. They have MUCH better customer service.

reviews.reviewTitle: No ideal for Spanish or outside US
reviews.reviewText: I, as an Amazon client, who lives outside the United States and paid Prime subscription for years, I must say that I made a mistake by choosing "Alexa". Still very immature in Latin Spanish and to be honest I feel like a second-rate client, because everything is made for clients in the United States. In summary; If your system goes to outside the United States or you need it in Latin Spanish, your choice is with "OK Google"

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device to connect all of your smart home items in one place.
reviews.reviewText: This is my base item for home automation. This is the device you need if you are looking to start your smart home transformation. This smart hub allows you connect over 20k smart home items in one package. I personally use the Ring doorbell, Ring alarm system, Nest thermostat, Hue lighting, and several other items and it's all managable through the hub and Alexa. This makes it super convenient and it's nice to be able to adjust everything in one package by asking Alexa to do it. Also the difference from the 1st gen plus vs the 2nd gen plus are noticeable. The main differences are the sound guality, cosmetic appeal and a temperature sensor. Overall I love this item but remember the price brings the hub for smart home automation. If you just want Alexa then this device is not needed.

It's a great little speaker. Sound quality is great for it's size. It's not as good as a larger system, but for the size, hiding in a corner barely noticeable, it does an amazing job of filling a bedroom with quality sound. It integrated right into my other Alexa devices and has had zero issues on that end. I got a "used-good" for a nice discount and I cannot even find the cosmetic imperfection, so I am very happy. I give it 4 stars because I feel like it's a bit pricey for what you are getting, especially when compared to an echo dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Creating your new Smarthome with Alexa
reviews.reviewText: Alexa Echo Plus 2nd Generation is as easy to set up on your own without professional help designing a Smart Home for you, play Amazon Music with up to 52 million titles of songs for a small monthly fee of $4.00 a month with a trial free month, as well as other available options for payment plans. Also available are Amazon Audials of any book, topic, etc with a trial period and a monthly fee of less than $15.00 a month with probably other payment options available. Alexa comes with a Phillip's Hue Smart LED standard bulb, which can be used in your living room for table lamps. If your lamp is a pedestal Wall Dimming Lamp using a non-standard bulb, the other option would be to use a smart plug outlet connected to the Wall Lamp, all controlled by talking to Alexa, "Alexa, turn off/on 1st/2nd lamp or "Alexa, turn off/on wall lamp" and programming Alexa using the Alexa Smartphone App to do all that plus control your Smart TV and Verizon FiOS automatically to turn on and select the channel you want to see, like saying to Alexa, "Alexa, Change to channel ABC", which turns on your FiOS Video Media Server and Smart Wifi HDTV at the same time, to channel 7, or pause live TV and play TV again by enabling skills to your Alexa APP which are subroutines within the Alexa APP, such as the FiOS skill, and other skills like Samsung Smartthings. However the FiOS skill cannot turn off your FiOS VMS but you can close your WIFI HDTV, using Smartthings skill which I think in the future the updated Alexa APP might contain an updated FiOS skill to turn off your TV as well at the same time. Also your FiOS VMS must be compatible with the FiOS skill. So now you can control your living room lamps by powering them on or off automatically by voice, and by voice recognition using your Amazon Profile. There are other smart devices like smart door locks, thermostats, refrigerators, dishwashers just to name a few devices outsmarting you.

I baught the dot a week before this one was released and was very satisfied with the dot except for sound quality for playing music. I am a Bose fan but didn’t want to spend the extra money on the bows that is compatible with Alexa so decided to get this and I absolutely love it the sound quality is amazing not quite as good as a Bose but definitely well worth the money saved by buying this and not the Bose for now
P.S other upside is I can pair this with my diet and play the music throughout the house and Talk to somebody that could be in the other room

The product works great and sound quality is about as good as Bose Bluetooth speaker. Alexa is as good as I expected... With Harmony remote for TV I am happy. Main complaint is volume leveling, there really needs to be addressed. Yes things are all recorded at different volumes, but there's got to be a way to monitor output and normalize it.

Just wish tie in app with phone was more functional. More of a tie in with phone functions... A second speaker tie in without having to buy two would be nice.

We actually got it because we had to download apps for our outside waterfall, spots, pathway lights and tree up-lighting before Insignia went offline on 11/6. Now we have plugs set up for various rooms, wake up alarms, and Alexa is even telling us corny jokes. Its a blast. I picked this one for the sound quality and it is pretty awesome for something the size of a smoothie dispenser. We're getting a new wi-fi system in the house and will integrate the unit into more applications at that time. Alexa stays!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought this for the Zigbee connectivity
reviews.reviewText:
I have six Echo devices, and about 25, Alexa-enabled products. So, you can see that I'm pretty enthusiastic about Alexa's eagerness to make my life easier.

I bought this particular echo because I needed a Zigbee hub for one of my latest gadgets.

I've got to say that in addition to its capabilities as a Zigbee hub, the sound is better than my previous generation Echo products.

As a result, I've placed this unit in our living room, where we use it not only to command our many home-automation lights and appliances, but listen to NPR and Spotify.

I bought the Echo Plus (2nd gen) because we have quite a few smart home devices that I wanted to be able to control from one source. This device allows me to do that with simple voice commands. It also lets me know when an Amazon delivery is coming and tells me when it has been delivered. As a bonus extra, I can now listen to radio stations in my home, something I was not able to do because of poor reception. And the sound quality is really good. Even my husband loves talking to Alexa and he is in no way a techie (he still uses the same flip phone he purchased in 2008.)

Used Amazon’s Trade-In Program which went seamlessly! Returned my Gen 1, same day I received Gen 2. (Don’t forget to reset your device before shipping back).

Setup was quick and without a hitch! Everything already on my Amazon Alexa app immediately connected on my Echo Plus Gen 2—yippee!

As other reviewers noted, there is a richer sound and for me that makes a more enjoyable listening experience.

....package, I was happy with what I saw. Then I set it up, (basically just plugged it in), and WoW, the sound is amazing. My Device controls plugs for lights throughout my home and it is really helpful once you get to knowing what your doing. Seems like I learn something new everyday about what can be done with this product. I would recommend this to anyone who wants great sound and the skills that come with Alexa.
Too me, it's entertaining to just try new stuff. This I believe, along with my Ehco Dot 2nd Gen, is a great purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why is Alexa playing advertisements when I get home?
reviews.reviewText:
New sneaky amazon development....walk in the door and suddenly Alexa tells us all about the Amazon sales going on.

Not impressed, and now happy now. She wouldn't listen to us to turn off while she was rattling on. If amazon thinks they can use it as an advertisement device I am NOT buying any more for my other rooms.

Aside from that decent voice recognition (I do have to yell though) and good smart home integration.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good sounding speakers but not as good as Sonos
reviews.reviewText: I have two echo pluses in a stereo pair. The sound quality is much better than the 1st gen echo that they replaced however the functionality seems to be lacking. There have been several occasions where my echo wall clock stops communicating also just recently “drop in”, timer and music streaming stopped working. I was able to get everything going again by resetting the clock, unpairing the speakers, pairing again and turning off the microphone on one of the speakers. Even though they are in a pair they recognize requests separately.

I have to say, first impression is just ok. I think we might prefer our 1st gen echo and still rivals this newer model. One thing I automatically miss is the ability to increase and lower the volume easily. The first generation echo volume is easily adjusted by simply turning the top. The echo plus volume uses buttons. The sound also, while impressive didn’t blow me away. As soon as you increase the volume to its full potential (but not to the max) the quality of the sound tends to deteriorate. I’m torn.

We're very pleased with the sound quality, We already have an Echo with the Woofer unit added in the family room, and it's great! We needed something for the bedroom just by itself and this Echo Plus init sounds great! If we want to stream through both units at the same time (they are in separate locations), we have to pay an additional monthly fee, which we are not ready to do. We only really need to use one unit at a time. The only problem is, sometimes when we use a unit, it says the other unit is streaming, when' it's not (as far as we know). It is quiet. So it takes a while to get that straightened out. I still give it 5 stars because the rest is pure gold.

I bought this for my wife and I as an early Christmas present. We love to sit with the TV OFF and tell Alexa any of the songs we remember from the past!! We try to remmember some of the songs from when we were dating 55 years ago and she KNOWS them!!! Alexa is very entertaining. Our grandkids love it. Great sound. MOST of the time it works great. I’m not sure yet why sometimes it loses it’s internet connection. Could be Soectrum, Alexa, or wireless router. Loses connection, but a little while later is fine. Needs a little tweeking for normal seniors to be able to hook up with the app on smart phone. Keep at it and you will get it. So many uses for all kinds of information. Could be a 5 star for someone that understands any of the minor problems we encountered.

I own two of the 1st Generation Echo Pluses and recently added a 2nd Generation. Those that have followed these devices over the past year or two know that the latest Echo Plus is now shorter, a little wider and comes with a 33% improvement in tweeter speaker size and a 20% size improvement with the woofer. Those and other improvements you can read about in their literature make for a better sounding product. If you enjoy music, the Plus is the best Echo product to buy.

I have also taken full advantage that the hub feature provides by having sound on all devises at the same time playing one of the fifty playlists I've created on Amazon Music. Also every room in the house has a smart bulb that Alexa can turn on or off individually or collectively or you can use the Amazon Alexa app. It also controls the smart plugs we have. Besides the Echo Plus playing music on demand the hub feature is a real bonus.

Easy set up; however, I am a newbie and resistant to smart home / tech changes...and disappointed with the lack of information provided with the item..took me a while to find out and where to even find a standard list of commands that come with Alexa....have honestly, not tried anythign but play music yet with it.

disappointed it does not integrate with my LG smart TV...that is a feature i was thinking would be available...it is not and very disappointing that the tv's that are too limited and that if i want to integrate with my current "smart" tv...i have to either buy a "smarter" tv or buy a Fire Tv Cube...not now...

Sound was amazing. Great clarity.

This echo continuously has difficulty staying connected to the internet, despite being in view of the router, and my previous 1st Gen Echo never having any problems in this spot.

Speaker will not allow me to put it into any groups in the Alexa app. It does not accept control from the Alexa app when I tell press pause or try to get it to stop/start playing music. The app usually claims this speaker cannot be reached.

I am mostly using this as an expensive Bluetooth speaker.

Great sound, nice size, easy to set up. But after one day, I started receiving social media ads and emails about things I was discussing. It’s listening all the time. Super invasion of privacy. And I can get my lazy arse off the couch to turn on a light switch.

reviews.reviewTitle: Old Fart likes Alexa, who knew?
reviews.reviewText: I am a 100% Disabled Veteran, the V.A. Southwest Blind Rehabilitation Program provides me with "accessibility" tools to make my life easier. Alexa came along for the ride, not that I really wanted it, but it was free (well you taxpayers funded it) so why not? It took almost a month for me to even plug it in. My kids did it because I didn't think we had much use for it. I am not totally blind, I can still drive during the daytime, but I do have issues here and there. Let me tell ya, as an old 0311, I don't trust anyone who is not a Marine Grunt or a Cop in the Air Force, (I only did the cop thing with the awesome 944th SFS at Luke AFB, because they gave me an M-60 and free pointy things to go with it) and I hate anything that is intrusive or could compromise my OPSEC . This thing has not changed my mind one bit, but it does keep the wife off my back because I don't forget the stuff she tells me anymore. Happy Wife, Happy Life. I highly recommend that this becomes part of your trash. If you need this translated, find a Grunt and have them explain it to you. My Kilo 3/1 (Westpac 89) brothers will understand. If they sold this in the Driftwoods store, I woulda bought a dozen. Semper Fi!

Love the sound from the new Echo Plus. My first echo was a pre-order first generation. Big improvement. However, I was having a problem with the new Echo Plus, contacted Customer Service (chat), got an agent who had to keep "checking with my supervisor", and I had to disconnect for time constraints. In the end I now have a bad Echo Plus, and a good Echo Plus. I was charged for the bad one too, even though I made multiple attempts to get a return label. And, I'm now streaming my music through Apple HomePod. Very disappointed in Amazon service. Still like the product.

The Echo Plus is sold as having a built in hub and they package it with the Sengled smart bulb. I spent hours trying to get it connected with failed results. Then I called up the Amazon customer service and the man told me that it won't work without a hub. I persisted that Amazon packaged it with a built in hub and this bulb. After hours working on this they said it won't work. Shame on Amazon for packaging these two products together. I am very disappointed in this product versatility.

reviews.reviewTitle: Needs to be more intuative with multiple adjacent commands.
reviews.reviewText:
Excellent sound.

Alexa can be quite difficult to use. Alot of the commands don't feel like natural language.

Simple mulitple commands aren't understood. IE: Alexa turn on the livingroom light, color red at 50%. Has to be 3 separate commands. Alexa turn on the living room light. Alexa turn the living room light to red. Alexa set the living room light to 50%. Alot of chatter for a basic 3 part command.

Wanted to absolutely love this device. Unfortunately I'm pretty disappointed with the unit.

The sound quality is quite good though.

I bought this because the Echo Dot (Gen 3) has poor sound quality for music at higher frequencies. That's the way they are made. Long ago, I had stereo equipment that reproduced music with good frequency ranges. The Echo Plus is built for better sound and delivers better sound.
That said, I will save up and probably buy Sonos speakers for seriously good music sound. At my age, I deserve it. I also like music that doesn't depend on pounding bass tones to "sound good". All the frequencies count.

reviews.reviewTitle: I won it as a prize
reviews.reviewText: I work at DDE5 and won this as a raffle prize with my DSP. I honestly would have never bought one because I really have no use for it. BUT since I have one now :) I think it's pretty neato. AI still has a long way to go and so does Alexa. Its always listening. Always. I have it next to my TV. When Amazon commercials play maybe ONCE in a blue moon it will recognize "alexa do so and so" and will turn on, rings go violently around in a circle and wont perform the task. So its genuinely okay to have it next to a TV that is relatively loud. My TV is a 55" LG. Over all it's a neato product but honestly not practical unless you like to say order this and that. BUT still have to go on the app or site to complete transaction. It also normally puts Amazon brand items in your cart FYI. It's good for music, or asking silly questions, and other facts it can tell you. I rarely use it. But you can also use it on your phone to "drop in" and talk/ listen to everyone going on in the area where it's placed. It can keep you entertained for a little while. But quickly becoming boring. It's cool though so. But like I said earlier. I won this as a prize and I would have never bought one myself.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just about useless for controlling home devices
reviews.reviewText:
Alexa will do cutesy pooh tricks that might amuse children. It also does many things not likely to be worth doing for most persons. If you want to control home devices, this is pretty much junk.

Amazon has awesome software engineers, but apparently they are not working on Alexa's klunky device scheduling routine. Maybe it will be okay in a year. It's not there yet, in my opinion.

If you want to entertain preschoolers, Alexa should work fine for a couple of weeks. If you want to control your lights while you're away, look elsewhere.

We use our Echo Plus to fill our room with Amazon Music Unlimited on a daily basis. Sorry BOSE, but I had to replace your unsmart speaker with this all in one product that does so much more, and fills the room with bass and treble that was very surprising to me. Great Sound, Quality and Functionality. Amazon hit it out of the park. Looking forward to amazing products from Amazon.

If you are questioning whether to spend extra for this product... absolutely if the quality of sound is your thing. Great product, delivery, and quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: Getting used to it and loving it
reviews.reviewText: I was on the fence purchasing this product. My cousin has it and we have fun requesting songs when we go to their house. So one day I decided to take the leap and purchase it. I also had to make the decision to get a streaming music subscription even though I have over 3000 songs on iTunes. I needed to roll with the changes and stop buy songs individually since iTunes will be phasing out. I am just staring to use Alexa for news and question of the day stuff but I still need to use her for much more. I am trying to add new skills each day. We will be obtaining WiFi light bulbs soon to use that function. So far so good.

reviews.reviewTitle: She listens worse then my kids.
reviews.reviewText: This is the second one and it’s still not right. My old first generation Echo Plus had beautiful sound but slowly started to go. The 2nd generation Echo plus sucks!

reviews.reviewTitle: Worlds better than other echo products
reviews.reviewText:
I had the Echo dot 3rd gen for a couple months and was really having a hard time deciding if buying the echo plus 2nd gen was worth it. I mostly wanted it for music and the smart home hub.

Let me say, if you consume ANY media at all; music movies podcasts etc this speaker is WORLDS better than even the newest echo dot 3rd gen. The bass is VERY present without actually vibrating everything the kids and the highs follow right behind. This thing FILLS the room with music and I love it. If you’re going back and forth about getting one, please do yourself a favor and make the jump. You won’t be disappointed if you listen to music, ever or at all.

I have had the echo's from the start and for Christmas this was for me. the echo Plus is like a sound symptom all in one. THE Bass is top and the sound is GREAT.So glad i did this the difference in night and day .All the new thing it dose it's the best. and got a 25.00 rebate on my old one. Thank you Amazon for all the best things and offers. Merry Christmas to me. PS: got the new Dot also.

This amazon echo sounds alright, pretty loud but will love some more bass, Sonos and HomePod still superior, but price wise, it’s well worth the price, I feel like Alexa would need some improvements, don’t get me wrong, it’s better than Siri in the HomePod, but it’s still can be better or at least have a cleaner interface like I have that I have an EufyHome robovac and I have to say “Alexa tell EufyHome to start cleaning” it will be better just “Alexa Start cleaning” and then Alexa just figure it out that it’s for EufyHome to start cleaning.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Echo, sound above average, voice recognition spotty-ish
reviews.reviewText: The updated Echo has much better sound than previous versions, and great Alexa integration. I placed this version on a raised candle stand as it sits a bit lower than previous versions. This may have placed it in a more reflective/confusion sound environment, or it is possible there is an issue with voice recognition in this model, but we continually have to repeat ourselves, and sometimes shout at Alexa. The audio is very good, but I would easily pay $50/$100 more for a more premium speaker system. Overall, it is a great upgrade.

reviews.reviewTitle: No more fighting over Bluetooth connections!!
reviews.reviewText:
I didn’t own any of the previous models but this echo has changed the way we enjoy listening to music at home. We always have music playing while my wife and I are cooking or relaxing in our garage or really just about anything going on at the house. I did get two echo dots to pair with this plus. The ability to pair all three and have the multi room experience is a huge game changer. The plus has amazing highs and bass response. With the dots paired, the sound is so rich. We did get a free trial for amazon music and after using it the past week, I have cancelled my Pandora and keeping the amazon music. We can hear a considerable difference in sound quality. The library is endless. My family definitely gives this a high 5 star rating.

We do have 2 Bose speakers that we would use and always fighting for which phone is connected. Which is why I got the idea of getting these speakers. No need to fight over Bluetooth connects anymore. The price point is spot on and very good quality. I am considering getting the amazon subwoofer but the boss at home said not now.

I’ve never owned any products with Alexa and she has surprised us in a great way. Alexa is so fun and the routines I’ve set up are always great. My kids love the stories and jokes she tells.

All in all, I recommend the plus and follow up with a couple of dots to add that extra enjoyment. It’s sound quality is amazing sealed up in a compact design. The cloth exterior adds a classy touch to our kitchen and bedroom.

If someone can find a way to make these portable, that would definitely be a huge deal at our house. That’s the only thing that I had an issue with but I guess a little sacrifice for now will do.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easily Set Up, Much Better Sound than Dot
reviews.reviewText: We had a Dot (that was a Christmas gift) placed in a large family room/kitchen. The sound was poor or annoying at best, but we loved the concept. We decided to get an Echo Plus for this large room and move the Dot into the Master Bedroom. The sound improvement, for music, but even more for voice, was immediate. We are not audiophiles, but enjoy good music and also use it for background while entertaining. We are very happy with this purchase and would make the upgrade all over again. The smaller space of the Master Bedroom was very suitable for the Dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is the Queen of Smart-homes!
reviews.reviewText: It's hard to say everything she does so well, but the smart home hub is definitely the best par. "Alexa, turn on the living room lights" "Alexa, turn the fireplace on" "Alexa, lock the front door" ...are just a few of the commands we use everyday. There is no better smart home device on the market. Period.

I love the product when it works. This one did not. I have several others of the echo and work great. Received this one and does not work will not connect. I have called and spent over 3 hours on the phone with customer service several times and keep telling me I have to call back and try troubleshooting again before they will issue a replacement. I do not understand why when I have tried this 3 times. Now they say I must call again and troubleshoot because he id not know what the previous customer service did. Second you are lucky if you can understand them broken English several times. I love amazon products but if there is a problem their customer service is horrible. why cant I just send it back and get a new one when this one does not obviously work.

reviews.reviewTitle: I LOVE ALEXA-MANY FUNCTIONS:music,weather, traffic,jokes, news, daily bible verses,etc
reviews.reviewText:
This is the BEST investment device!!!! I am a pre med student & it reads my kindle Chemisry books to me. I can as Alexa jus abt anything & 90% of the time she hav a answer. However being a pre-med student maybe the developer can add my Organic Chemisry to Alexa cuz she didn’t kno Organic Chem other than the definition. I love my
Alexa. I tell Alexa 2 mk a “To-Do” List, a Grocery List & a Personal List & its also on my cell phone so if I’m away from hm I can jus look in my Alexa app instead of forgetting a paper list or worrying abt Alexa being at hm w/my list on the device. I LOVE ALEXA-MANY FUNCTIONS:music,weather, traffic,to Do List,read kindle books 2 u, google info, smart home hookup, daily bible verses,news, jus abt anything BUT NO ORGANIC CHEMISTRY HELP😩

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Once you figure it out..
reviews.reviewText: After a few hit and misses with 'pairing' lights/sockets and such... Alexa is working Great! Beware though of every 'Smart' product out that does not easily 'pair' with Alexa. And, I had some trouble download the Alexa Software to my Laptop... strange error msg with an IP address?? Also Customer Support was VERY VERY BAD. Supervisor's were supposed to call me back (from the Philippines of course)... never happened. Chat person said a Tech would call me.... never happened. Good Luck ! But once you get the hang of it... it's pretty Cool. Wish that there were more options to rename 'Alexa'... wink wink.

Great sound. Unfortunately it is not much of a hub. Would not find any of my devices. Had to buy a Wink 2 Hub and I have not been able to connect the Echo to that. Very frustrating. Save your money and buy the plain Echo for the speaker.

We've enjoyed using our Eco Plus. This was a gift from our daughter. We are not a "smart" home by any stretch of the imagination. We live on a farm in a rural area without really good internet access. So, there are many abilities of the Eco Plus that we do not take advantage of. But we've had a blast asking Alexa to play certain songs, tell us jokes, update us on the weather, etc. I've even used reminders. We've only had the Eco Plus a couple of weeks. I'm sure we will use it more and more. I am thoroughly impressed.

I buy at amazon for their customer service. I have a google home, and this device imo is better. I love the sound quality!! Has a balanced mids highs and bass. It’s worth it for the built in zigbee hub and sound. Alexa controls my Fios TV, HEOS/Denon receiver, and lights. Since buying this, I have been looking for more ares for automation. I just ordered a second “plus” since it’s on sale for 119. It’s worth it!!!
Some integrations are a little buggy, which may not be all Amazon’s fault. None of these issues are a show stopper.

We were looking for a product that could do the work of the Bose radio and the CD player (two separate devices) in part for ease of use, and in part to save space. We found it in the Echo Plus. It has great sound and access to an incredible amount and variety of music. Despite the fact that we are "senior citizens" and were equal parts amused and uncomfortable with the hilarious mock of Alexa on Saturday Night Live last year, we remember "her" name and find the Echo Plus delightfully easy to use.

Would not pair with wifi. Kept saying password incorrect even though I know better. All troubleshooting led me to having to remove security features from my router and I'm not cool with that, not for a toy like this. Definitely not worth the trouble.

I bought this because my young daughter had the echo dot. I wanted it for communication between the front of the house and the back. I use it for music. So when I clean I can turn on pandora and play it to the everywhere group. That way I can hear it throughout the house. I bought my son an Echo, my other son and echo dot, myself another echo (for upcoming chistmas gifts). So when its dinner time I can just broadcast a message and let them know to come to the kitchen to eat. It will be fun to listen to Christmas music coming out of every room.

Excellent device with excellent sound. Buy this if not for the hub but also the thermostat and excellent sound.

I have 2x generation 1 echo's and I thought they had great sound. Once I plugged this in and listened to them side by side I was amazed by the difference. The gen 1 echo sounded like listening music in a pop can. I got the plus mostly for the better sound and am not disappointed. I wanted some bass without getting the separate sub.

My 11 year old daughter has been asking for Alexa dot since last Christmas. This year I decided to get it for her and after reading the reviews I decided that I wanted one too, so I decided to get the Plus for myself. I am so happy that I did. She wanted to be able to control the lights in her room so I purchased a box of Sengled Smart light bulbs as well. The set up for both devices and connecting with the bulbs was quick and easy. We have been playing with both the plus since this morning, asking it to play music, about the weather, the time etc. I cannot wait to see what else this little device can do.

The Alexa Echo Plus 2nd Gen provides a great sound that fills up my entire 1st floor. The loudest I get it is volume 8 because that’s as loud as I need it to go. I took it to my uncles pole barn where we had about 20 people over for games and drinks and it sounds like a stereo system in the place. It works extremely well with other smart home accersories that I use and has plenty of fun games for adults and kids. It looks really nice on our shelving unit and blends right in. Highly recommend!

I postponed buying an Echo or similar device for a while but I'm so glad I did. The set-up was a breeze and I connected it to my thermostat, home security, Pandora and with the free Hue smart bulb that it came with in about an hour, if that. I was worried it wouldn't have enough base, and it exceeded my expectations. The sound quality is excellent. I should have bought it a lot sooner. Now I want one in each bedroom lol. If you are on the fence about it, get one! It's fun and makes life easier.

I just love mine . Just dont understand .
Why I ditten getit sooner .
You can lestend to your favorite Radio stations. Are your play list on Amazon.
Arecask her to tell you a joke . Are what she thinks about something. Love her she even tell me back good night . In different ways each night. Like sleep tight
Or sweet dreams.
Are hope you sleep well . I really love the sound it puts out on my music.
I'd recommend her for any household.

I purchased an Amazon Alexa back in 2016 and it was used mainly to amuse my seven-year-old daughter. She would tell Alexa to play her favorite songs and would dance to her songs. That was then and this is now. It is amazing how far along the Amazon Alexa has come. Now you can use it to set up your smart home devices, make calls, send messages, send announcements and even use Alexa to show you your DIY home security cameras. This is just the tip of the iceberg in terms of all the items Alexa can do. When I hear about people making a fuss about people from Amazon listening to their Elexa comments, I thank Amazon for hiring all those employees helping to make Elexa continuously better. There are so many things that you can do with the New Amazon Alexa, that I can spend hours and hours learning the features available within the Alexa app. If I had a nickel for all the times my wife has told me to stop using my phone or tablet, which then keeps me from learning and doing more things within the Alexa app, I would have accumulated enough nickles to buy ten Echos. Thank you, Amazon for all the work that you have done to make the Amazon Alexa as amazing that it is. If listening to me with my Alexa devices will continue to improve the Amazon Alexa, then please listen. I have nothing to hide. I can't wait to see what further incredible things Elexa has in stored over the next few years.

Received this as a gift. I don’t think I’d have ever bought this for myself, but it is useful. The Echo Plus has fairly good sound quality and it is handy to just tell it to play whatever music we want, rather than turning on the stereo and selecting something to play. Using it with Alexa is much better than using Siri, which we seldome use. Alexa is so much smarter than Siri and gives in depth informed answers to difficult questions. It tells me when I have Prime orders that have shipped and again when they arrive. Overall a nice entertainment and information center

You know, I was a little hesitant about ordering this product but I LOVE this product. I like when you say Good Morning to her she will give you some history on what happened on this day years ago. I use the weather info from her but the best feature for me is the ability for her to keep lists of things to buy and do for you. You just say...Alexa Add milk to my shopping list. You can name lots of different lists and she will keep it one on its own list. You can do reminders for the day. I could go on and on but I LOVE this items. Also, when I play music...GREAT SOUND.

It's fun, it asks me a question of the day, usually in history, science, literary or general knowledge categories. I can say "Alexa, play NPR." We do have the light bulb which can be controlled through Alexa in one of our lamps, and that can be convenient. I don't link my contacts to Alexa, nor do I shop on Alexa, or much of anything beyond what I have already listed. I'm sure she can be more helpful, but do I really need to submit and not do anything for myself? Also, I mistakenly called her Siri one day--she didn't think it was funny.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent soung in a small container....
reviews.reviewText:
This echo has an excellent sound, nice bass. Like a Bose sound all within a tiny box. I love it. I was trying to figure out how to get the wired sound in my home but now I don't have to go that route because Echo Plus is the answer. Also, to hear unlimited music, you will need to purchase it for $3.99 monthly. You get 30 days free trial. You are basically forced to purchase it or it will not play unlimited music for the artist you want to hear.

Dislike- With this smart sound, I don't trust that it is completely private in the home where Amazon or third parties can listen in your home when it's not playing so be sure to go to your Echo Pluse App to set the private settings & turn the microphone off after each use. I sure hope there are not hidden cameras in it.

My family really enjoys this and it gets very heavy use in the kitchen. We have dots all over the house but this offers better sound quality where we use it most and it’s small enough to keep on the countertop. I would buy this again. I like how you can stream music to all of the echoes through the entire house or to a specific room. We also like how you can “drop in” like an intercom and make announcements across all dots. We also have one integrated smart plug which gets very heavy use. Very nice product.

The truth, I did not know anything about the world of intelligent or systematized systems for home. Alexa surprised me. I decided to buy one after knowing the alexa echo dot 3rd generation. After many comments, videos, sound tests, I stayed with alexa for the great quality that has comparing price / quality / functionality. I am an Apple user and the truth has nothing to envy to HomePod. Totally recommended. I just hope that I will soon make an update of use to be able to use alexa in my country (Chile) and be able to use it to make calls (it is deactivated and only works in: USA, CANADA and MEXICO). But outside of that, totally recommended still sonically.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great quality sound from such a small speaker
reviews.reviewText: I originally had a google mini but, was not happy with with the options to stream music and being an amazon prime member I have amazon music that I like to use so an Echo seemed like a good solution. So far the sound quality is much better than the google mini as expect. I have it centrally located in my house and it disperses the music nicely. The receive microphone is also very good as well. It can pick up commands even through music at a good distance away. Still a little creepy how it seems to be listening all the time but, over all I am happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Its great, but Amazon prefers to use its music service over Spotify
reviews.reviewText: It was a great device.... However, I got very upset it preferred to use Amazon Music over Spotify when I had both set up through it. I ended up having to broadcast Spotify from the app through the device to get what I wanted... It ended up being a glorified Bluetooth speaker at that point. Also the bass rattled the device sometimes at half volume which got irritating over time. If Amazon chose to allow you to choose your preferred music streaming service and fixed up the noise rattling it would be an easy 5/5.

reviews.reviewerName: Very addictive game. That is all that really needs to be said.
reviews.reviewText: My home has 4 adults living together (3 of which have their own prime account). I was hoping to purchase this, link the rooms together and begin purchasing "smart home" products. However, because of the rule that says one of us have to give up our Prime Account and be listed as Teen or Child with all the restrictions to link up our Amazon accounts, this system simply will not work as I wanted or intended.
