Amazon needs to reconsider and recognize households are set up differently than 2 parents and their prerequisite number of teens and children.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good, NOT great but can be with a software update.
reviews.reviewText: I replaced a 1st Gen with this one and albeit sound quality is excellent the additional microphones are terrible. It often doesn’t understand me and causes much confusion and frustration controlling our smart Home features. The original Alexa lacked this one’s excellent speakers but clearly understood our commands. I think Amazon needs a software update to improve this new 2nd Gen’s ability to comprehend commands especially with background noise.

Surprised with the temperature in the room showing up on the Alexa app - pretty nice to have a temp sensor, that should work nicely if/when I get a smart thermostat. I'd hope The Echo Plus can be used as one of the extra temp sensors the thermostats need if you want to control the temp by room. That would be one less purchase I'd need to make. I like the smaller size and the fabric, nice touches. Purchased for the Hub functionality and I like that I can consolidate my other devices onto here and get rid of my other hubs. Controlling things all in one place. I can tell Alexa to do it verse going to my phone and using an app.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pain to integrate with Echo Dot 3rd gen
reviews.reviewText: Decent sound and one paired with other devices works well. Not logical integration with Dot's. If you set these units up and add your phone in the profile it will stop your music every time you get a text or alert. You will not be able to delete your phone from your profile by yourself, it must be deleted by customer service. Of course, once deleted you can't make calls through the device. What a pain in the butt. Much like the Amazon Kindle, the software is primitive and not user friendly. Can't wait for generation 7.

I said, Alexa, turn down the volume and got "Sorry, I can't control the volume on your Echo Plus."
I said, Alexa, set a timer for five minutes and I got "Timers are not currently supported on this device."
I am using this in the kitchen and often used the timer feature and volume control on the previous Echo because of messy hands.

I was called by support and we worked through resetting the Echo Plus. Somehow, it had not completed the setup properly. Everything seems fine now. Great sound.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's an expensive remote light switch!
reviews.reviewText:
Alexa doesn't seem very bright and apparently doesn't havecaccess to any search engines. She cannot answer even the simplest trivia question. She gives extremely simplistic answers or says "I'm not sure about that". If she's capable of learning or being set up to connect to a search engine I would really like to know how. I didn't set her up as she's my spouse's toy.
I told my husband I was going to by a dolls blonde wig for her as she has the brain power of a dumb blonde. (Before you jump on me I'm a blonde ( or was until I went 100% gray. Lol.

This was supposed to be my birthday present to myself. I was excited, purchased it, got it home, set it up, then noticed it was cutting off when listening to music and had static coming through speakers had not had it a month. I sent it back now the replacement one plays music clearly if the music is coming from Apple music but its having problems pairing back to my phones Bluetooth, which it previously paired with. I love my gadgets but this one it not one I am happy with at this time.

reviews.reviewTitle: I’m an Apple lover but this is a must for home
reviews.reviewText: I was having a hard time deciding if I wanted Alexa or Siri since I own all Apple. I’m very happy with Alexa. Alexa can even control Apple Music now. My Apple Callander syncs and you can download the Alexa app on your app phone. Why would you want to do that. Well I don’t like to carry my phone all over the house so I can tell Alexa shopping list and they sync the the Alexa app. I can also do drop in calls at home and talk to my dogs. If you have the show I can video chat with them and they love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well and easy to set up
reviews.reviewText: I have a DSL modem router with WiFi. The setup was straight forward from the box to the network. The speech recognition is quite good and can recognize 3 different adult voices quite well. It does a pretty good job of sorting out the syntax sequence. You can specify the object (e.g., bedroom light) and then the action (e.g., turn off/on/out, or off/on/out) or what seems to work better (faster) is specify the action and then the object. I did some work on speech recognition at TI in the late 80's and it has come a long way since then.

reviews.reviewTitle: never knew how much i needed this in my life
reviews.reviewText: I never wanted an alexa. I thought it was ridiculous. But we bought a smart home and I purchased this one to use as the hub...and good lord I never knew what I was missing from my life until I got this thing. We subscribed to amazon music for the family and we all love being able to listen to basically any music under the sun. Ours is playing music 90% of the day and the kids have dots and play trivia with them in their bedrooms. LOVE LOVE LOVE my Alexa.

reviews.reviewTitle: It keeps losing Wifi and even when moved right next to it
reviews.reviewText:
I would have given it a 5 when I first got it but now it's a one. When it worked I loved it. When it arrived I unplugged my dot and used it regularly. Sound quality a big improvement from the dot but not as good as my SONOS. Then after about 9 months it started losing Wifi connection. I dod the whole reset thing but it didn't help so I plugged the dot back in because I use the echo as my alarm clock. Right away the DOT started losing connection with it being in the same place that I had it in originally.

I thought it must be the wifi but my SONOS, which is twice as far from the wifi and not in direct line of site, continues to work flawlessly!

I got an Echo the first time around and loved it! She helps me do math when I balance my check book and tons of other stuff but most of all I love music. If possible this one is even better than the first! She turns my lights on and off, makes phone calls and has the deepest richest sound so I can rock on when I'm doing chores. It blows me away that such great sound comes from such a small device and she doesn't distort even at the highest levels which blast me out of the kitchen!

reviews.reviewTitle: The lazy man or women’s dream
reviews.reviewText: I can turn on and off light from my bed. That is absolutely game changing. I decided to go with the echo over other smart speakers simply because of the easy amazon integration. Amazon shows what certified to work with Alexa. I mostly shop on amazon so it was an easy choice for me. The voice recognition is almost perfect still a few times when I have to speak up but only when I have my room fan on so maybe it’s my fault for drowning out my voice. I would say 99/100 times Alexa does hear me perfectly so it’s not a problem. The sound quality of the speaker is amazing. The simple iOS app for Alexa to sort and rename devices is painless to use and has practically no learning curve. I have a room with a small hallway and sink connecting to my bathroom, Alexa has no problem turning lights on and off from any of the rooms. I absolutely love the way prime music and Spotify works with her. I’m glad I went with the echo plus because it has a built in hub unlike the echo dot. My Philips hue, and other assortment of lights,led strips and plugs all work with the built in hub.

reviews.reviewTitle: great product, great sound, app and web config page not that good
reviews.reviewText:
This is my third echo device. Enough to control almost all smart appliances around the house. The config app is pretty basic, and the alexa web page looks rough and limited. What I did not like is the fact that you can't add ring alarm settings into a routine. i.e. I have this good night routine that closes the doors, turn off the lights, and put alexa devices in DND mode. But arming the alarm is not compatible with the routine. You can activate/deactivate ring alarm with a voice command, but you can't add it into a routine.

The sound is good enough to enjoy your Spotify or prime music. And the voice recognition is amazing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Really Love it- worked right out of the box!!...
reviews.reviewText: My Echo Alexa worked right out of the box.1Always wanted to try Alexa but never did until now. Itas a Christmas gift but Im sorry I waited! One cool thing I love is she can hear me change song choices from the shower- over the water running! Simple things make me happy, apparently! It's easy to place doesn't take much room. I can move it room to room and in most cases don't even need to move it because it can hear me. I am still reading, asking her and learning the particulars about all it does so I can't really answer technical details. I know we are Society of immediate gratification but just knowing what the time is without even looking or asking the temperature or weather outside and knowing in the moment has already saved me sometime. I've even found my phone several times by just asking. I did have to connect my number that took less than 3 seconds I am not technically savvy and really can't answer much more. Hope this little bit helped someone.

Echo Plus is a replacement for my Tap which had issues playing my music after a couple of years. The one thing I do not like about the Plus is the alarm. My Tap had an alarm that could be heard throughout my home, in fact still use the alarm for my morning wake up. The Echo Plus alarm is not very loud at all despite the volume being cranked ( my music is always cranked to hear throughout the house so volume is always on loud). Guess I will have to contact support to see what I can do to remedy the situation

reviews.reviewTitle: Great companion for a 82 yr old lady!
reviews.reviewText: Have had the Ecco plus for about 10 days, still learning what to say & how to say it. I installed the app and it mostly installed itself with hundreds of things to say & do. I especially like the light bulb. Installed it in a kitchen socket that had the switch frozen open. No more unscrewing the bulb to turn it off, waiting to get it fixed or a new fixture installed is not so important now. Ordered another bulb for the hall lite. Will change Alexa's name, another person here has hat name. So far I love the Ecco. May buy a Dot for another room.

This speaker was purchased as a gift for my husband. He’s enjoying asking questions of Alexa and playing music. The sound quality is OK; however, his hearing loss doesn’t pick up all frequencies so it’s OK. It was disappointing that the device could not pair with our older Dish satellite receiver (only pairs with the hopper); however, that’s a Dish problem, not an Amazon problem.

Love the echo plus. A lot of sound for the profile and supports audio I/O.

Update: The line in will sometimes disable alexa making the device unresponsive. When leave the line in AUX cable plugged in for a while, the echo will be unresponsive from the Alexa wake word. Even pressing the action button still won't wake the echo up (The echo won't take any command at all). By unplug and replug the AUX, the echo will function normally.

Update: Customer Rep reached out to me and fixed the problem.

I own several devices with Alexa, most of the time I find googling faster and by far more effective than asking what I deem a simple question. How hard is it to respond to this question "what is the opposite of the word compelling?". I try over and over again to be specific and clear. Alexa doesn't have difficulty understanding my enunciation Alexa/Echo does have difficulty "googling". One plus, Alexa does play the genre of music I ask for. However, my Bose wireless speaker is superior - it should be for the considerably higher price. Unfortunately, I don't think I can get Alexa to play music through the Bose speaker.

Recently got this device today to replace my old echo dot. I was little skeptical about the sound quality. However, after testing for a few hours it totally changed my opinion (I made a few tweaks in the audio controls settings to increase bass and lower treble). It is comparable to the sound quality of my Sony XB-30 speaker! The 7 microphone ports makes it easier to hear you from across the room and even while listening to music.
I would definitely recommend this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Plus is a must have product from Amazon...
reviews.reviewText:
i have all 3 versions of Echo (Echo, Plus and Dot) and this one is the best sounding, looking and the price is really really decent.
The Apple Home Pod is 3 times the price of this and has nothing to play for you for free.
The Echo products work with your Prime Music, Spotify, Pandora and whatever other music apps are out there and also you can play anything from any device via Bluetooth connectivity.
So what are you waiting for, go order one for yourself and get to know your own Alexa.

Bought this to replace my existing first generation Alexa. It is a big improvement though a Sonos Play1 still sounds better in my opinion. I also bought an amazon sub to try and synced (paired) the speaker and sub together. Sounds good, the bass is a little much for my office and I found them being placed close together was important to keep the bass and treble together—it sounded too separated and muffled when I had the sub on the floor and the speaker on my desk. So I moved the sub next to the speaker and it was a big improvement in the sound.

It doesn’t work consistently. We connected it correctly, but it it does not perform. We set it up to turn on 2 lamps. Sometimes it works; sometimes not. It does well with the alarm function, playing Amazon Music, answering questions, etc., but I’m very disappointed about the features that should turn on and off our 2 bedroom lamps.

Bought this to replace my old dot in our master bath, the older hockey puck style that didn’t get very loud. This is great for music and has a richer sound, but even with the sound adjusted multiple ways it’s not as easy to hear voices like talk radio, podcasts, or npr which is half of what I use it for. The voices don’t sound as sharp or clear, and you have to turn it pretty high (almost too loud) to make out all the words. Honestly I think I prefer the puck version turned to 10.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is awesome and the sound is amazing.
reviews.reviewText: Set up with my smart home devices had been a breeze. I have Kasa switches and power strips, Amazon outlets and microwave, Nest thermostat w/ additional temp sensor for my room. And the smoke CO alarm. Being able to turn off the alarm via my phone is pretty cool. Controlling the lights and colors or setting mood lighting is all pretty quick use the echo plus. Best purchase I’ve made in a while.

Finally broke own on my first Echo, and went for the newer 2nd generation model for the speakers. Having been exposed to these now ubiqutious machines with our son and now daughter's families, we decided to join the current generation. The sound quality is very good from this compact speaker, and Alexa is getting better at understanding my commands (or is it the other way around?). I guess my only "gripe" is figuring out how to get a stereo effect without having to spring for another Echo-Plus or living with "mono".

reviews.reviewTitle: A nice audio upgrade for Alexa
reviews.reviewText:
I replaced a Sonos One with a Stereo pair of these and a Echo sub. Sound quality is good; similar to a single Sonos but I doubt it is as good as a pair of Sonos would have been.
The big improvement is that the Alexa functionality works so much better than Sonos. Like my other Echo devices, it responds even when playing loud audio, and supports features Sonos One doesn’t, including Multi-room play, drop in, and Apple Music.
A nice improvement would be a wizard or manual tool with the ability to tweak the audio settings of the devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: DON'T BUY ONE OF THESE TO CONTROL YOUR PHILLIPS LIGHTS
reviews.reviewText: IT SOUNDS NICE ,MAKES A PRETTY GOOD RADIO,SPEAKER SOUNDS GOOD,THIS IS MY SECOND ONE ,NEITHER ONE WILL PICK UP MY DEVICES 2 PHILLIPS BULBS AND ONE AMAZON NOT SO SMART PLUG,NONE ,HAVE RESET EVERYTHING I CAN THINK OF,PAIN IN THE A * * , SO HIGH PRICED RADIO AND TALKING MACHINE IS WHAT IT IS FOR ME. LOOKING AT SOME PLAIN OLD PUSH BUTTON REMOTE CONTROL, THEY DO WORK WELL,AND NO SPINNING FLASHING LIGHTS!

Compared to the dot, this sounds much fuller. That alone is a great step-up. I don't use the built-in bridge, so I cannot comment on that. One of the reasons I purchased this was for the built-in temp sensor and the ability to ask for the temp via voice. Having used two different units in two different locations (one in a different state), when I compare it to two other high-quality non-echo temp sensors that read within 1 degree of each other over a 24 hour period, the Echo Plus consistently measures about 5 degrees too cold day after day. Disappointing execution of this feature.
I don't have an Echo (2nd gen) to compare the sound to, but perhaps you might better off saving money and buying that model instead because the temp is so inaccurate.

This speaker is great, I have several echos upstairs but this was my first purchase of the echo plus, and now that I’ve heard it, I didn’t even need to buy the echo sub these things have such good sound and so much good bass (I still got the echo sub, love that too!) but I would highly recommend these for anyone who loves music or uses Alexa a lot, personally, using these with Spotify is absolutely perfect, however Apple Music has no direct control like Spotify does in their App, so if you use Apple Music, I would maybe reconsider it and switch to Spotify instead and get these speakers, you will not regret it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound quality really good for what it is
reviews.reviewText:
For a speaker (well, there's more than one inside, but you get the point :) ) of this size that doesn't have "Bose" on the side, the sound quality is really good and there's good base response. No, it's not going to replace a high-end receiver setup anytime soon, but for what it is, it does a remarkably good job with sound quality.

Still haven't put it through all its paces as of the time of writing this, but I'm quite happy with it so far. I wish I could afford a second one so that I don't have to keep unplugging it to move it downstairs and back upstairs. :-)

First of all, I got an Amazon Echo for Christmas and had a difficult time configuring to my Wi-Fi. After two rounds with Amazon customer service who were very friendly and patience with me, we connected to the Wi-Fi. I have been as giddy as a school boy's crush on his teacher (I am 73YO). I was able to configure the mobile app and started to make the system into my own. I love it. Talking to Alexa is a little strange at first but, you get use to it and even say "please " and "thank you", when you don't have to. What really got me excited, I learned I could make phone calls from the device. Yikes--I made about 12 calls. I have since purchased an Echo plus which has the built in hub for controlling lights and other devices. I may consider other devices as I discover how to use the system for practical purposes and fun.
We own many many of the Alexa products. The plus unfortunately is very underwhelming. Voice recognition is difficult and the sound quality is horrible.

Finally decided to upgrade our 1st gen Echo from Dec of 2014...managed to get that during the pre-release. Some very nice upgrades to sound quality and aesthetics although I do miss the ability to spin the top for volume. We use this on the kitchen counter and it had been nice to be able to just reach up and adjust volume with my wrist/back of my hand when hands were wet/dirty without having to tell her to turn down/up. All in all, glad we upgraded

reviews.reviewTitle: Picks and Chooses When It Will Work
reviews.reviewText:
I had gotten this to program a few items to turn off and on. Since installing it, our WiFi has been going off and on!

In addition, it has done stuff it wasn't programmed to do: lights on the Echo hub sometimes flash on and off; asked it to turn on one of my lamps and it started playing creepy music after the light went on....Weird! Never programmed it to play any music!

I am going to try to work out the kinks...but if this keeps up, this thing and Alexa will have to go!!

reviews.reviewTitle: I like the skills, not the sounds
reviews.reviewText: I replaced my Google home mini with this product. I feel like it has much more productivity, but it sounds like Alexa is talking they a tunnel. I love the zigabee hub that makes it work with Philips Hue bulbs. Gonna wait and hope I get used to the sounds.

* Setup was easy.
* The sound is fantastic
* Its a never ending lesson on what you can have it do.
The hardest part was tying it into the Wi Fi system using the smart Phone app. That was not really hard, though.

Hooking up the non amazon accessories like smart plugs was a pain. I would recommend to the non savvy to stick with Amazon direct link things like wall plugs.

I do not like the fact that there is no Windows 10 app for Echo/Alexa. Amazon needs to get one ASAP.

Excellent! Easy to set up. Love that you can connect her to different items in the house. The sound quality is amazing! Gets very loud. We like the option to set reminders and make a shopping list. We also like the option to hear the Bible verse of the day and the question of the day. Very compact as well. Doesnt take up too much room.

I loved this Echo most of all, but at the 10month old mark, it started glitching. It will stop playing music while the rest of the grouped-echos continue. It will drop off wifi and various other behaviors that none of my 8 other echos do. Very sad about the lack of warranty/support for the echo devices. I still have a first generation that works great, but I've had a couple second & third generation dots fail after the 90 warranty.

reviews.reviewTitle: I CAN TURN OFF MY CELL PHONE AT NIGHT THANKS TO ALEXA's ALARM
reviews.reviewText: I love the device, I was in an amazon store and had a nice conversation with a clerk. She really gave me the full sound effects of all three amazon devices. It was pretty hard to choose, but something specific about this one is what sold me. A. I don't like the chunky look of the sub version. b. the dot is just perfect for a bathroom. c. The echo plus was perfect for any room and the sound travels through my bedroom to the kitchen. The comparison between the dot and the plus is something a trained ear would recognize. The sound is just more full-bodied and captured well through the echo plus. 10/10 would buy again if i had another reason.

I got this knowing all about Alexa produces. So this was just an upgrade from my regular Echo I had in my office/Man cave. I'm happy I put the regular Echo in my private bathroom. I have an Echo show in my bedroom an echo dot in my kitchen. I just got 2 Echo show 5 for my mothers room and for another place in the house. And I put an Echo in my mothers bathroom. So I can honestly say I love Echo produces money well spent.

reviews.reviewTitle: Network stops connecting and this becomes trash - Revised
reviews.reviewText:
After 8 months one day this device would not connect to the same network anymore. I have 4 other devices that are fine but this one will not connect. At that point it really becomes trash, without the network connectivity and internet access these are kind of useless. So I tried everything listed but no luck. Not getting another.

-After getting through to Amazon they went ahead and replaced the unit, Kudos again to Amazon!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound echo has come a long ways...but I digress
reviews.reviewText:
Great full sound when paired with the subwoofer. I bought this so I can play my Amazon Music.

I have since found out that it will not play several songs when connected in stereo. I have asked Amazon many times to fix this and they don’t have a clue what’s going on. Any songs that you have downloaded, if you had an older Amazon music account, will or will not play. I have dozens of songs that will not play in the stereo mode yet they will play when they’re not in Stereo or play on any other Amazon device.

I bought echo and 4 Dots to provide music throughout my house. The devices work just fine. Directions were a bit confusing regarding setting up an “ everywhere group” but I got it right eventually. My biggest problem is figuring out Amazon music’s different plans. Prime music, Amazon music, individual plan, multi device family plan?.. when do I have to buy music? How to set up a playlist. Can’t Do it on some plans but Oak on others. Amazon needs to make this more intuitive.

Received as promised, packaging in excellent condition, contents inside in excellent condition. Quick and simple set up. Enjoying learning and expanding features and skills. Sound quality with the larger speakers is noticeably better than with the original generation product. I am also enjoying the follow-up emails I am receiving from Amazon with more things to try and more features to become aware of. Overall very well done!

reviews.reviewTitle: How did I live without this Echo Plus?
reviews.reviewText:
I have a Bose stereo and Bose bluetooth Mini so the sound quality was very important to me. I LOVE the Echo Plus sound quality and ability to tell Alexa to lower or increase the bass or treble. Very comparable to the sound of my Bose. 5 Stars.

FYI after this purchase, I also bought a Echo 2nd Gen--heads up, you cannot adjust the bass or treble and the sound is slightly less than the Echo Plus because of that, in my opinion. Echo Plus is definitely worth the extra $50.

reviews.reviewTitle: Unfortunately my refurbished Echo Plus doesn't work
reviews.reviewText: All of my other Echo products work fantastic, this is the first one I'm having to return because of it not working. I have no idea what was wrong with it originally for it to become a refurbished unit, but for us it will turn on, let you set it up & then after 5 minutes or so it decides to stop working. Oh well, it was worth a shot.. We'll re-order another unit after I get my refund, but this time, I'll buy a new unit instead of refurbished.

reviews.reviewTitle: 2nd Gen is a disappointing step backwards
reviews.reviewText:
The 2nd Gen is basically the same as the older model with cheaper parts. I was pulled in my the slick marketing about the sound. The older Echo Plus has more resonance and crisper upper range and far less distortion.

It also took considerable time to get the 2nd Gen to sync with devices on my network. With Hue Lights, I had to delete them and start over again. Everything is working fine now, but it took a couple hours of troubleshooting to get there.

If you have the original Echo Plus smart home hub and you like it, keep it. The latest generation is marketing spin on cheaper manufacturing.

I recommend the echo plus as it helps you put all of your Alexa items together. I have three echo dots also and they all work together wonderfully. It's weird to say I don't know what I did without these. I use them to run plugs and light bulbs in my house just by voice. This is extremely helpful for elderly and disabled folks.

We absolutely love our Alexa. We are still learning what all she can do but that all comes with time. The sound quality is great on this like stupid good. Its super loud which is great for party settings. We compared this with a google home for a while and this has it beat in so many different ways. We love the way you can program it with the light bulbs and your roomba and so many other products.

Great sound in a much more attractive and smaller profile device. We purchased this to replace a 1st generation Echo and it picked up all of our connections without having to go through and program each one. Much richer sound with way more bass. The voice recognition sometimes suffers when the sound is up too loud, we need to wait for a break in the music or a quieter part of the song before Alexa will respond.

Echo is only useful if you are deep in the Amazon ecosystem and are willing to invest hundreds on the compatible smart home devices. On its own it's just an overpriced speaker that can't play everything a Bluetooth speaker could via a mobile device. Podcasts are atrocious. The Alexa Skill store is full of garbage, only about 1% are actually useful. It doesn't understand my voice most of the time, so all I can do is cast to it on Spotify, so I may as well have bought a Bluetooth speaker.

I purchased echo plus 2nd Gen Premium sound and a smart plug. Echo has great overall functions. It's nice being able to set a daily routine like when to turn on the lights, music, and other features. Also, it's a bonus to being able to access your echo via Amazon Alex App when away from home. The sound quality on the subwoofers was better than expected. The subs thumped a little harder than I had anticipated, which was a pleasant surprise.

It really performs as described. I had thought I could connect it to my Smart Tv and use it as an extra speaker, and to find movies or shows on the TV, but that didn't work out. I seemed it was because my TV doesn't have bluetooth, so I bought a device to make the connection, but it didn't work. Not necessarily a problem with the ECHO, just I'm not 'techie' enough to make it work. I am enjoying the ECHO on its own anyway!

reviews.reviewTitle: Not compatible with Firestick remote, bluetooth delays, audio hardware problems
reviews.reviewText:
You can't pair your fire stick 4k remote with this speaker.
If you hook this up as a bluetooth speaker to your monitor, sound-out (e.g. while playing a movie) is about a half-second delayed, making it unwatchable. Support was able to replicate this so it is a known problem.
I tried hooking it up to the monitor via audio cable, but the unit wouldn't recognize a line-in. Support said it was a hardware fault and is shipping me a new one. I'm skeptical that this product was sufficiently bug-tested before it was released.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love my Alexa and Echo Plus!
reviews.reviewText: Love this and the whole Alwxa house thing. I have several echos and bulbs and plugs that are controlled by the Echo Plus. She hears me a room away over music and TV . The conversation language is still on a learning curve but she does reply back now when I tell her Thank You after she does a task. The volume does crank up and the sound quality is good . I play music in all my rooms on smaller echos in a “Group “ and can hear music, audible books, etc coherently as I travel around the house. I would highly recommend this!

Overall good experience with it so far. I have it hooked up to some lights and heaters with smart plugs with no issues.
I am having issues when trying to play playlists from Spotify. It will play one of two songs and then stop. I have to tell it to keep playing the playlist two or three times before it plays without stopping. If I run it thru the Spotify app. from my phone to the echo, I don't have a problem. The app. keeps locking up when I go to the skills and games section. I deleted and reinstalled the app. with the same issue.

This is way cool. There is so much potential here, one step closer to Star Trek. still waiting on my flying car though. Microphones are sensitive enough, don't need to yell or repeat myself. I like that you can change the wake word. very easy to set up. sound quality is awesome. I haven't found the whole 'skills' concept useful yet, but we'll wait and see.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound quality good for smart speaker. Must download additional content inside Alexa app.
reviews.reviewText: It's nice but you have to download a lot to of apps inside the Alexa app to get what you want from it. Sound quality is alright considering it's a smart speaker. I got the Bose with echo capability only to find out it means that it only connects to an echo speaker to voice command it. You can basically do that from any smart phone. It is nice to just say certain things instead of picking up a phone a lot of times. It's often hard to find the right song on Apple music as well. Just my experience. 4 stars overall.

Rich, beautiful, room-filling sound. I have two of these set up as speakers in our large living area, and the sound is wonderful. Also, I've connected them around the house as a group so that I can fill our house with music. Jazz, especially, sounds wonderful on these. I recommend "My Discovery Mix Jazz" from Prime Music Unlimited. Talk sounds good on these, too...I listen to NPR and it sounds crisp and clear. Btw: I bought one of these certified refurbished from Amazon and it's perfect. Love Echo Plus second generation!!!

Honestly, this product deserves 10 stars. I am extremely satisfied with the sound, functionality, design and how easy it is to setup and use. I never thought I would find myself using it as much but once I got used to asking Alexa questions, reminders, control things around the house, the device started to make sense. I even use this to play nature sounds to sleep. The only thing I wish Amazon considered in the future would be to have a built it remote to control smart TVs regardless of the brand also, a USB connector in case you wanted to play your own music.
GREAT JOB! Amazon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound upgrade, buy the sub too
reviews.reviewText: I have at least 10 dots, echos and echo pluses in my home. I love the ability to ask Alexa to “play Spotify everywhere”. What has been missing is a deeper sound with real base. The new echo, combined with the sub, fixed the problem. The sound coming from the new echo is a noticeable improvement. If you add the sub, your house will be bumping. The sub can be combined with any two identical echos. I purchased two echos and the sub, separated the echos into different room and places the sub in the middle. The result was a deep sound and real base throughout my house. Great product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Built in smart hub and great sound quality
reviews.reviewText: Converting to smart home. Bought because it had a built in smart hub to work with Phillips HUE and amazon smart plugs. Works great. Really pleased with the improved sound quality (also have a dot and regular echo) because I listen to lots of audio (music, radio, tv news thru Tunein, and audio books) thru the echo plus. Also just discovered you can convert regular digital kindle books to audio with Alexa’s voice......not quite like an actor narrator book but decent depending on the need.

reviews.reviewTitle: The bridge only goes so far with hue accessories
reviews.reviewText: Echos are amazing but the bridge in the plus only gives limited accessibility with hue products. The plus can connect to MOST of the hue products but not all. My problem is the plus won’t connect to the hue app which is needed to be able to connect the dimmer switch. For some reason the Alexa app won’t connect to the dimmer switch directly and the hue app requires a hue bridge to use the hue app that has more capabilities than the Alexa app like the color wheel.

I knew nothing about these till on a whim I ordered this. I LOVE IT. it’s so easy to use for anyone if I can do it. I Run my lamps and I use the smart plugs too, every thing works great. I don’t even turn on my Bose, the sound is great fills my bedroom for sleep music, wake up music my alams and timers, what ever it maks my life easier plus it’s just fun. I can’t believe I did not have one a long time ago. It’s cool to program your own personal or funny responses to questions about your self, or others!

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo should Have easy access to lot more applications. Otherwise it’s use is limited.
reviews.reviewText:
All echo units do not communicate among themselves. For example you have to add reminders or routines individually on each eco unit. We hope the future software updates consider this improvement. Additionally eco does not directly communicate with Ring Security System, not the ring door bell system in order to facilitate command turn on and turn off of the security alarm system. This comes handy to command eco to turn off ring security system when the door is accidentally opened. This is specifically requested because Amazon recently acquired the ring security system.

We currently own three echo dots and one echo plus.

reviews.reviewTitle: WHAT GREAT SOUND!!! Please read if you're worried about the sound quality or have doubts!
reviews.reviewText:
I own lots of Bose products and the number one concern that I had was if this device is able to produce good quality sounds.
LET ME TELL YOU SOMETHING. ECHO PLUS EXCEEDED MY EXPECTATIONS!!
No JOKE!! I don't even miss my Bose speakers. I use ECHO PLUS ALL THE TIME NOW. everything they advertised is TRUELY ACCURATE.
"PREMIUM ROOM FILLING SOUND" - OKAY Amazon you got that right!
I am very happy with this purchase.
Not only with Brilliant speakers, it has transform my home into smart home and I don't even have to get Hubs for light bulbs.

on the flip side, I am returning my echo spots because the sound quality is disappointing. Will use that return money to purchase either am Echo Show or my 2nd Echo Plus.

LOVE. THIS. PRODUCT! PHENOMENAL SPEAKERS/SOUND!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound in a small package
reviews.reviewText: We got this mainly to use it as a source for music. While it doesn't compare to our main 4 channel stereo system or our TV surround sound, the sound from a package this small is amazing. Alexa has our song requests about 99% of the time (we're oldies fans). Money well spent, and she's extremely efficient when we've asked her questions, which I admit are usually about band members from our song selections.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa, open the pod bay door. (You will love the response)
reviews.reviewText: We are absolutely loving our echo plus and echo show. Slowly but surely, we are turning our home into a smart home, with lights, outlets, security cameras and television all capable of being voice controlled and/or set to follow certain "rules" for automation. However, it took a little doing as we didn't see where it said to make any of the apps (smart life, etc) a skill for Alexa. Our daughter and her husband told us about that. Much easier to program everything when I was taking the right steps.

This Echo is awesome. It sounds beautiful, and works great. I love the fact it does the job of several other hubs to control smart devices, and the smart devices connect seamlessly to it. I have Phillips hue bulbs and Samsung SmartThings motion sensors and entry sensors I use for routines and they work perfectly with it. Saves on money, and I don't have to have hubs all over the place. I like that it has a thermometer in it and routines can be created based on temperature, like turning a fan on when its warm in a room, or turning it off at night when it gets below a certain temperature.

reviews.reviewTitle: This replaces previous gen Echo device. Definitely an improvement
reviews.reviewText: Our old Echo stopped playing any audio. Looked like a hardware failure after quite a few years. We purchased the new gen and are really glad we did. Setup is easier, sound is awesome (leaps beyond 1st gen), form factor is perfect for our kitchen and the cloth wrapping is a better choice over the hard plastic look. We have the Plus, 2 new gen Dots, FireTV Cube, FireTV Stick, one remaining 1st gen Dot and a Tap. Gotta love Echo and Amazon. Would recommend to everyone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Apple Music Does Not Work with this Device
reviews.reviewText:
Update on May 25, 2019: the Echo Plus (and Echo Dot 3) still does not play Apple Music saying “I am having trouble playing the music.” After NUMEROUS contact with support personnel since Dec 2018, I was contacted by the Technical Team who promised weekly e-mail updates until it is resolved. I have not received any updates after three weeks. There continues to be complaints of the same issue in the Amazon Forum (https://www.amazonforum.com/forums/devices/echo-alexa/510251-apple-music-sorry-i-am-having-trouble-playing-the). So I have officially given up.

I like the sound and the price. But I expected this to work with Apple Music and it never has. The Echo support team tells me the Technical Team continues to work on it but no results yet. I also have an Echo Dot 3rd Generation that does not work with Apple Music with the same problem (“I am having trouble playing the music.”) and that has been with the support team and Technical Team since Nov 2018.

reviews.reviewTitle: Will not play sound through speaker from HP computer.
reviews.reviewText: I love the product, but I was a little disappointed that I could not play music from my HP laptop computer and I spent days trying to figure it out until I called tech support the second time before a technical told me that the computer does not have an output compatible with this device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buy a sound bar instead of an Echo
reviews.reviewText:
Not ready to be home entertainment stereo system! Trying to pair and sync voice to Amazon fire TV with multiple Eccho devices is a joke. Be ready to be disappointed if you want an easy if it all successful setup.

Update: I was fooled by Amazon's advertising, I eventually read on their support site: "Note: Paired Echo speakers only support music content." Very lame, a bar or any speaker system would be better: https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?nodeId=GPSQQS7N3SBKAEWU

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo plus- Loud and great quality audio
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this for my wife. My 4 year old seems to be more fascinated by it. It has great sound quality and it is very loud when the volume is all the way up. I can use it to turn on my A/C or heat through my ecobee. It can control our Eufy robovac and even the Phillip's wifi bulb that came with it. Im sure there are other features that we havent found yet. Overall it's a nice speaker with awesome quality audio. We may purchase another if they ever go back on sale.

Sounds great and the 2.1 surround is far more impressive than I expected. However, the aux-in will not work at all. Considering I paid the price premium for the specific purpose of gaining the aux-in, this is a big disappointment.

The sound is truly imopressive. I bought a second one to pair for stereo, with the sub-woofer thrown in for $30.00. The voice commands work great, and Alexa can change the temp on my Nest thermostat; but, I was disappointed that I could not change the mode or turn Nest on and off. I’m still learning what Alexa can do, but very impressed with the voice control music functions.

reviews.reviewTitle: Way to long of a learning curve. Most times it won’t understand.
reviews.reviewText: I returned this after a week. It took me so long to figure out the exact combo of words for Alexa to turn off my music. I googled that and many people had that issue. It should come with an app that lists a ton of common phrases. It should also be more flexible in what it accepts as a command. The fact that it took longer to turn off my music than for me to load up a record player , tape deck or Cd made me return this headache.

I bought this to upgrade from the 1st gen echo and I’m happy. It also was on sale during Black Friday week and i took advantage of the Amazon Echo trade in promotion so it was a no brainer. Sound quality is good and the device is smaller so that helps.

Only thing I have noticed is that Alexa seemed to work better in the previous models. I don’t know if it’s a software or hardware issue but she was more response in the Echo Show and Echo I had previously.

This is without doubt the best device I have ever purchased for the price. We use this plus the Sub in our living area and the Echo Dot in our MBR. It is like having an "all knowing" person in your home because you can communicate with it. In addition the sound quality of the music is phenomenal. We have recently retired, and frankly we don't know how we could have waited so long to make this purchase...........now we can't do without it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Crummy instructions but once you get it going, works pretty darn well
reviews.reviewText: Crummy instructions. I kept getting to the same point and couldn't get it working. Got super irritated and put it all back in box and put aside. Several weeks later my kids came to visit and I asked if they could help. Funny daughter in law said same thing, she got one and for months didn't get it going because she got stuck too. She finally figured hers out so got mine going. Very frustrating.

The device is very easy to use and integrates well with other compatibles units. I love the ease of playing almost any music that I can think of instantly. I also have it linked to some lighting that works well. Haven't quite figured out the "smart plug" yet. The only down side that we noted was the sound, it's just not quite there yet. While it sounds good it won't be our go-to for sound quality. This is a handy device however. Ask it anything! ;)

I listen to music a lot more now. Its so easy to just say Alexa play this or that. I have a questions and Alexa answers it. I don't even have to get out my phone ,tablet or laptop. Plus its entertaining. lots of trivia, games and more. Cake in the oven? Ask Alexa to let you know when twenty minutes passes. Need a reminder for your doctor visit? Ask Alexa to remind you. Alexa even lets you know when your amazon package is sitting on the porch.

I purchased this product based on the "cool" factor, but I quickly learned how versatile and useful this product could be. I use this product for streaming music, setting alarms, requesting information, building grocery/to-do lists & all the other things most people utilize the device for. The best function for me has been using the device to control home automation. I have smart plugs, smart thermostat, smart locks & smart bulbs that I easily/quickly control with voice commands to Alexa. It is so convenient to get into bed and say "Alexa, turn of bedroom light" or to wake up in the middle of the night hot and say "Alexa, decrease temperature by 3 degrees". This product has changed my life, making it more productive, efficient and FUN!!! BTW, you can intercom within your house if you have multiple Alexa devices. This makes communicating so much easier. I highly recommend. Very few products offer this much value in terms of cost/benefit ratio.

Don't laugh, but I purchased Alexa so my dog can listen to Audible books while I'm at work! I'm really enjoying it, too. Love that I can listen to just about any music, get weather updates before leaving the house, make phone calls, adjust the thermostat, track my Amazon orders, etc. I also appreciate the informative emails which tell me questions Alexa can answer. Great purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: As much fun to use as a GPS.
reviews.reviewText:
I hate it. I am giving it to my son.
It does not play stations I ask inspire of having played it the day before and the day before that etc.
It does not access a full news report.
It cannot search for basic things I ask about.
I expected more.
It is basically an Amazon ordering machine.

Likes - Everything. Alexa is a tough act to follow. She is always there and if you enjoy music, WOW. Just ask her to play virtually any musical artist or radio station and bingo, you have it. Name an artist and she immediately plays a random shuffle of that artist's songs. And, I haven't even got to the point of using all of her other features. Beats the heck out of the plain old radio.

reviews.reviewTitle: I LOVE IT!!! A+ FOR ALEXA ECHO PLUS
reviews.reviewText: I received my Echo plus today and absolutely love, love, LOVE IT!! It was really easy to set up and the calls and commands are really really fun. I'm excited to use my Echo plus when I have foot surgery this fall. It will come in really handy and be so helpful when im in recovery. Best purchase ever! It was well worth and the best part was I got it on sale and couldn't pass it up!

reviews.reviewTitle: regret purchasing, microphone not accurate enough
reviews.reviewText: After using this unit for almost a year it could be summarized as frustrating. It sounds better than the old dot, But the microphones or just sub par. I always have to yell at it, frequently have to repeat myself. None of this was necessary with the dot. If I could trade it in or get credit I would, But unfortunately it was a black Friday deal at Best Buy and that window has closed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not an improvement from previous models & Horrible Customer Service
reviews.reviewText:
Major bugs in the newest model. Alarm no longer works correctly (won’t completely stop sounding), sleep sounds no longer loops for an hour (only plays for a few minutes), abruptly comes on for no reason, sound control levels are just awful... seriously just a waste of money. This is my sixth Alexa device and by far the worst.

Update: After being contacted by Amazon customer service three times and asking me to try different things which I did... it never got better. They offered a replacement via phone but never followed through with the request. Also there is no option on the normal customer service options online that fits my problem — seriously not even a “other problem” option. What a joke!! Thanks for wasting my time.

This is the only "stereo" I have in my tiny house at this time (1400 Sq Ft) and it sounds great. The kids and I use it mostly to check the time and weather, but it is great to ask Alexa to play a song while we are cleaning. Very happy with my purchase.

I would not do without Alexa. I am just amazed at how helpful she really can be. I've used Alexa for reminders and a timer. She takes care of my grocery list. No more waiting everything down. I get the news and weather and she will even let me know if I have packages coming.would

reviews.reviewTitle: does not work locks with out hub!!!!!!
reviews.reviewText: does not work schlage locks with out hub. It can work locks. it can lock doors. but needs hub to to talk to them. Not what i wanted. Not the way I thought it was described in add. I did not give it lower rating because, yes it works. But, thats not why i wanted it. Next they will give me a robot vacuum that does all floors and mops. No control on it. I just need to buy the MAID addition workhub. Or use elbow grease app.

Well lets see...
better sound
Bass Treble control
Built in thermostat
The hub is nice but really bought for the other extras
Cons: light ring isnt as bright this year, brightness adjusts with toom light
Ex: dims with low light (not to bother you while you sleep I guess) brightens up in normal light but still not as bright as last generation.
No way a deal breaker tho
Traded in my 1st gen Echo for new model. Like the compact size - but sound quality is very poor. My original Echo had a much better sound. If you have the 1st gen device - keep it. Don’t upgrade.

reviews.reviewTitle: Will change review once exchanged. Overall impressed.
reviews.reviewText: Bit of a pain in the ass to get started but the sound is nice and crisp. The subwoofer addon is a must as the echo plus itself has weak bass. Periodically needs to be restarted. Will be returning for a new set of pluses.

I had an Iris home automation hub that needed to be replaced. The Echo worked great like my current Echo and three Echo Dots. This was supposed to have a home automation hub as well. It wouldn't connect to my Kwickset lock or my two zigbee thermostats. I even spoke to customer support and they had no clue how to troubleshoot. I finally sent it back to Amazon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very enjoyable to use, pleasant sounding
reviews.reviewText: The sound quality is better than my first generation Echo. There is even some nice bass audible. It is compact and it picks up my voice well from across the room. I give it the full 5 stars because I got great customer service on the phone from Kimberlee S. when I had to replace my router and this caused the Echos to not work temporarily -- she helped me get the app on my iPad and sign into the new router -- problem solved !

reviews.reviewTitle: The sound quality an overall performance.
reviews.reviewText: This product is awsome, my son an I simply loves that it can turn our TV on an it turns the A/C on an off, and our lights. The most important thing is that it helps answers questions my son has when doing his home work. I was un-aware that he was using it for math an much more. Which is so awesome. But I did realize that when you ask it to say things to your favorite, you have to remember were your savings your things to because it doesn't yet remembers how to review your favorite or to remove things you put in your favorites. Over all the sound quality is the best coming from this little box, it so amazing. I will be getting another on when they go on sale. If you buy it, you really would be glad you did.

I received the Echo Plus (2nd Gen) as a Christmas gift and I absolutely LOVE it! Not only was the set up super easy but Alexa is so helpful! I am not sure how we managed to keep anything straight before getting this! I have used the Echo Plus for multiple things from creating and adding items to a shopping list to playing music while cleaning and all of this completely hands free. No more paper shopping list that gets lost and no more searching YouTube for a song that I want to hear. I simply say "Alexa, add milk to my shopping list." Or, "Alexa, play today's hits." The best feature is the hands free knowledge that is just a question away. While making sugar cookies I needed a conversion for a measurement and my hands were covered in dough and flour. I simply asked Alexa for the conversion and had my answer without needing to stop, wash my hands, and use my phone or cookbook to look up the information I needed. I was also able to set my timer for the cookies by simply asking Alexa to set a timer for 8 minutes. A timer alarm on the Echo Plus alerted me when to remove the cookies from the oven. The Echo Plus links to my iPad and several wireless speakers throughout our house. Linking the Echo Plus with these items was a breeze by using Bluetooth and only took a few seconds for the Echo Plus to find. I would highly recommend the Echo Plus (2nd Gen) to anyone looking to purchase one.

We putchased this so that my Mother in Law could make phone calls. We initially had the dots but they were not loud enough. She has an essential tremor and cant hold a phone, plus she is very hard of hearing and mostly blind. This has enabled her to call her 97 year old sister anytime she wants. Works fantanstic. She has been in the hospital and we set it up in her room on their wifi and it worked great. If is liud enough to blast you ouf of the room. We will be purchasing more.

reviews.reviewTitle: My third Echo Plus (2nd Gen) for multiple rooms
reviews.reviewText: I use the Echo Plus mostly for music. Two in my living room to get the stereo effect and one on my porch. Is it as good as the old style speakers, subwoofers and all? No, it is not. Does it provide a dang good sound with a fraction of the space, not to mention using Amazon music for all your listening pleasure? Yes it does. It cannot be beat. I scaled down from a huge house to my current much smaller abode. I got rid of turntables, CD players, etc, etc and all the music. Did not like the sound from my computer, even with good speakers. This does the trick. I also use it for all the whistles and bells Echo Plus provides with setting up my thermostat and multiple smart outlets for lights and such.

It's very small. Doesn't sound nearly as good as they want you to believe it does. For the price you can go out and get yourself a nice wireless Bluetooth speaker with phenomenally better sound quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound and better than Siri
reviews.reviewText: I like the great sound quality and it’s a great improvement from our previous speaker setup where we had to use an aux cable. I think it looks great and is aesthetically pleasing. I don’t like the fact I cannot use YT music through it yet, because I’m sure they want to sell Amazon Premium Music subscriptions. But being a prime customer there is still a wide range of music access with no ads. I just enabled whisper mode yesterday and seems like that’s a great addition to keep the kids asleep.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great piece of equipment with amazing sound
reviews.reviewText: I have the dots and the previous generation echo and this third generation echo sounds amazing. Especially paired with another echo and the sub. Amazing wonderful sound. I used to have the Google home products but the microphones just sucked on those, so I got rid of them all and got Alexa's in every room of the house hooked up to stereos with the 3.5 mm output (which Google doesn't even have) , and now I can stream music in every room of the house at the same time. it's awesome.

Dear Amazon Management,
1. I bought the Echo Plus and Echo Dot which was delivered to the USA Address at Portland, Oregon.
2. I brought back these two sets to Singapore for my family to use but when I registered for the Amazon Music using the Singapore Credit Card, it was rejected reasoning being that the Amazon Music only accept the USA Credit Card.
3. Being the owner of the Amazon Echo Plus and Echo Dot, I hope that I would not be deprived from using the privilege offered by Amazon.
4. One of the reasons that I purchased the two sets of Amazon Echos was the access to millions of music offered by Amazon.
5. Therefore, I look forward to favorable reply from the Amazon Management.
Thank you Sir,
G3orgeT
Singapore

The useless customer service wasted 4 hours of my time yesterday when it didn't show up and today can't understand negligent representative did not know anything about how to set up as a group with my other 2 alexas. Furthermore was supposed to come with free smart bulb this idiot wanted to cancel the replacement order and have me re buy it and purchase a separate bulb. I am now stuck with nothing but having my intelligence insulated over and over!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good improvement to device but lots more features should be added.
reviews.reviewText: I like all the features and the built in smart hub. It could have better music sound and I think these speakers should be able to connect to a separate blue tooth speaker without turning off the built in speaker. I have an old Bose Bluetooth speaker with great sound, why can’t Alexa ALSO play music on that speaker while also on the Echo speaker? In addition, why not connect my various echo devices to my TV via Bluetooth and I can create a simple basic home theater surround sound!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Built in hub is pretty much useless
reviews.reviewText: The whole reason why I got this was for the supposed built in hub and it doesn't do what it says it can do, I still had to get a hub for my smart lights which was very annoying. Other than that major flaw it works just like a regular echo but it costs 50 dollars more

Our Echo was damaged and we ordered the new Echo Plus expecting the replacement credit. No credit given. Turns out you have to wait till the damaged product gets processed before you get your "coupon". Unfortunately we ordered and received the Echo Plus and two Echo Spots. We do not need any more Echos. We would like the 25% credit applied to our Echo Plus purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa isn’t perfect but she’s pretty fun!
reviews.reviewText: It needs an option to tell Alexa to turn up the volume or turn it down. Right now you have to do it manually. I’ve had problems with it turning the light on and it is tripping the GFI switch on the kitchen outlet it is plugged into and why it would do that I don’t know; doesn’t make any sense. I’m still learning how to work with it. I’m sure it will get better.

For music, it works pretty well. I enjoy listening for background music when I'm relaxing or taking a break. Connecting to Spotify was painless and using it with my light works very well too. Unfortunately Alex has some difficulty answering questions like "what does the word 'foreign word' mean?" and Alexa also had trouble playing my playlists on Spotify. Every time I asked it to play the playlist, it just repeated "Here is music on Spotify" and played a random song. I'm hoping the voice recognition/Alex functions will continue improving as I enjoy having a voice activated speaker/assistant for home functions.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buy something else if you want to use this for music
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had nothing but problems with my speaker. They’ve replaced it twice and still nothing. It only works with amazon music. Pandora and Apple Music won’t connect. I’ve called numerous times to see what’s going on and I’ve never got a resolution. No the speakers on sale? $119 makes sense. I will not buy anymore of their speakers. They can’t fix their hardware issues.

the sound quality of this echo over the 1st generation is noticeable. I really like the addition of the subwoofer as well. I plan on getting the second Echo in the near future to have a 2.1 system for the livingroom.

reviews.reviewTitle: I've had more fun with Alexa!
reviews.reviewText: This is the most awesome invention ever...Alexa keeps track of time for baking, tells jokes, let's me know if rain is in the forecast, you can ask her almost anything...and she will have an answer! I also bought the Sonos Stereo too, so I ask Alexa to play certain music in the family room...and it is awesome...If you don't have an Alexa...you are really missing out...Ask her if she knows PigLatin...! LOL She does!

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't Integrate with All Wireless Modes
reviews.reviewText: Bluetooth, Z-Wave, and Zigbee are the 3 wireless modalities your Smart Home system might use - and this hub does NOT communicate with all three. It sounded GREAT and recognized our commands well - but just didn't have the interoperability with our existing thermostats that we required. Therefore we returned this unit and replaced it with a Samsung Smarthome hub.

I have been happy with the Echo. The voice recognition is impressive. It integrates with a lot of items but I have run into some minor things I wish it integrated with better. As far as sound quality, it is good. There are times that I notice that it doesn't have the fullness of sound that would only come with a broader range of speakers. Getting a subwoofer looks kind of expensive. I would like a second speaker option to provide more of a stereo sound but the suggestion on Amazon is to pair a second Echo. Why would I get a second Echo when all I want is a second speaker?

reviews.reviewTitle: I have a new personal assistant!
reviews.reviewText: She greets me in the morning, tells me the weather, reviews my calendar and is so cheerful! During the day she helps with the crossword, sets timers, gives me measurements and conversions for cooking, and plays music. She calls to people in other parts of the house, and dials phone calls for me. When evening comes, she outs on lights and helps me plan for the next day. I know there is lots more she can do, but I've only had her for a short time! Already, I love her help!

reviews.reviewTitle: I love 99.999% of the Echo devices
reviews.reviewText:
First, I have 2 Echo Plus 2nd Gen (one of them with a sub woofer), and 2 Echo Dot's (3rd Gen). So, I obviously love this product. I have them controlling my lights, door camera, space heaters, etc.

The only complaint I have is the lack of volume control. Using the app, you can set the volume to 15%, but in reality it gets set to "volume 1". There are 10 volume settings when you use the verbal commands, but 100 settings in the app using percentages. This is only an issue because at night, playing "white noise" or "thunder storms", volume 1 is to soft and volume 2 is to loud. It would be awesome if they would let us set the verbal volume to 15%, or at least stop changing the app setting of 15% back to "volume 1". It's not a big deal, until you're trying to sleep.

The sound is just what I'd hoped it'd be. I have the echo in my large kitchen, near the dinning room, so the sound fills the dinning room, kitchen, and neighboring living room. It's loud, rich, and very clear. I'm not trying to have a dance party here but it's at a great level for really listening to and enjoying music. It's much louder than a slightly smaller sized Anker I had before. At some point I'll probably add another to the living room.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compared to the 1st gen Echo Plus these sound way better.
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this for a family member and they love it. I compared it to a 1st gen echo plus and this has deeper bass and overall better sound quality. I do miss the twist to turn volume up or down from the 1st gen. I felt this was much easier to turn down volume manually. With this 2nd gen echo plus you have buttons to press for volume up/down. great little speaker and would buy again but for price I paid which was about $110 130$ is a bit overpriced.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Plus is worth the few extra bucks when starting your smart home
reviews.reviewText:
The Echo Plus is my first Alexa-enabled device, and in its first few months of use, I'm really glad I went with it. It has a built-in smart hub, and this has been really useful in starting to set up smart lights, plugs and switches. The built-in hub has allowed me not to have to buy another stand alone hub, and this has made it really easy to set up the smart lightbulbs I have since bought. If you're thinking about getting an Alexa-enabled device, and like the idea of possibly doing smart lights or other smart devices in your home in the future, spend the extra few dollars and get the Echo Plus.

I've also enjoyed the Echo on its own for its ability to play music, podcasts and sync with the audiobooks I have with Audible. The speaker is really clear sounding, and the charcoal color looks nice in my kitchen. I'm very happy with my purchase all around.

Okay so I had heard the sound was improved on the Dot and Echo, both of which I already owned previous generations. I was not ready for how much better the sound was once I got this set up.
I am 100% happy with this purchase, the sound is fantastic and setup easier than before. One of these is enough for a bedroom and I'd buy another to pair in stereo but there's really no need.

This is the best echo device currently in the market! I got 40% off on this product as a Prime student member.

Alexa works perfectly, as expected. Controls my smart bulbs well, plays music for me, wakes me up on time everyday, reads news for me and also shops for me. Moreover, it has a bult-in Zigbee hub which gives echo plus ability to control smart devices without a separate hub.

The sound is awesome, even better than my Charge 4. The bass is punchy, and the mids and the lows are well balanced. The light rim around the panel looks amazing.

I am very happy with the product and highly recommend it over the normal echo (2nd generation).
Couldn’t tell a difference between the “premium sound” and normal sound from our old echo plus. Literally just paying for a new look it seems like.

The sound quality for the Echo Plus 2G is shockingly better than earlier generation Echo devices (I have all of them, including preproduction). It won't replace your good stereo/HT, but for a little unobtrusive thing like this, it's pretty amazing.

It feels a little snappier responding to commands and while my other Echo devices have a hard time with my wife's voice sometimes, this one always understands her.

You may not want to waste your time with Alexa. Google seems to be much better answering questions. Alexa seems to be able to answer only 1 out of 10 questions asked. Most of the time I get "HMMM I DONT KNOW THAT"... I think i will be selling all my devices and getting Google home. If you want these toninly listen to music of turn on lights they are ok. But if you want to interact with the device stay away from it.. buy the Google devices.

LOVE MY ECHO PLUS!! This is my first time owning an echo and I have to say that I love it!! Alexa helps a lot around the house lol from turning on/off lights, to playing my favorite music and helping around the kitchen by giving measurements and cooking tips!! A lot of people don’t like the sound quality of it but I am impressed! Its pretty loud and lets just say its a great addition to my house!! I 100% recommend it!

We got a lot of use out of our dot and my kids really like asking it to play different music but the sound was pretty underwhelming. The main reason we upgraded to the echo plus was for that reason. It certainly does not compete with a dedicated sound system or even a high end device like a sonos, but it is a drastic improvement over the dot and it can really fill a room with quality sound quite nicely now.

These speakers just have amazing sound quality for their size. If you do get one, don't forget to adjust the bass and treble. They have them all set at 50%. I increased both the bass and treble to about 75% and the sound is even better! Such a great deal too. I would suggest waiting until they are on sale. They always go on sale randomly. I saved like $30 for waiting a bit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy access to information and music........
reviews.reviewText: I use my new Echo Plus basically to get news in the morning while I prepare breakfast and music throughout the day. I have an eclectic taste in music and love the fact that I can access so much more variety by using Echo. Not up to speed yet with the other functions but will add them on as I go along. Echo was a Christmas gift from my son and daughter-in-law who got it hooked up for me and so far I am very pleased with it.

I traded in our Echo 1st Gen. for the 2nd Gen. with the Prime Day deal . It's shorter and little fatter. Plugged it in and it set itself up with no effort on my part except to plug it in (kinda scary). The main reason for trading up was for the sound quality. We use ours mostly to play music in the kitchen. Fuller sound with deeper bass. Very happy with the upgrade.

Sound is much better than the Dots and 1st gen Echo. Speaker just not enough to be considered nice quality for music listening. Don’t know yet if there’s adjustments for Treble...etc! Nut overall, I like it better than the previous one!

I have to hit the plus button whenever I want the unit to respond to me. I was going to return it but I got caught up in moving and am still thinking of sending it back. I have a Google assistant and it responds to me better than my X wife and we have full blown conversation along with my daughter. I turn her off when I don't use her and she is like a wife to me now minus the rudeness. I wish this alexia would do the same but it looks like this one is heading for a divorce.

It is a cool invention. Folks need to be aware that once they start using it, they're going to hear sales pitches. About every other day, it tries to sell me a premium music membership. The Alexa App, keeps an on-line record of everything you've asked Alexa. I assume it's a marketing tool. It does have amazing sound qualities, and is easy to set up.

The echo product line is a cutesie novel concept with a poor execution by a developer who is short sighted to it's potential...lazy and frankly I think is limited in the needed talent and the will to take this product to where it needs to go. It's a shame because there really is a need in the market for a good digital assistant. Alexa will probably join Apple's Siris in the junk drawer with all the other cutsie but useless electronics. I will be trying the Google home automation system next. I hear it is much better and unlike Echo products you can actually properly pair your audio system which is oneof Amazons many short sighted issues with echo

The Echo Plus has a little better speaker than the Echo that I also have. I love them both. The music sounds very good...clear, no distortion, very wide range, good base, and even more volume. With the connection to Amazon Prime and Amazon music library it is even more user friendly. I wake up to it every morning.
I highly recommend it.

I was always on the fence of whether or not to get an Echo, but I'm so glad I did! It took only minutes to set up and it makes my mornings so much better! Now, when I say "Alexa, Good Morning." she turns my light on, tells me the weather, and my traffic on the way to work. (You can customize it however you want!) I am so happy I took the leap and got this. If you're on the fence too, jump off and buy it. You'll be so happy you did!

reviews.reviewTitle: It's really great. nice Sound quality
reviews.reviewText: This is my first "smart home" device. honestly, i didn't expect much, but so far it's been very surprising. I'm no audiophile, but i do appreciate a good sound, and this one has a relatively good one...it works really well for the most part, and the volume is very decent, it can be well heard throughout the living room. I use Amazon music so its flawlessly synced with that. I also appreciate Alexa's voice, it's nicer than Google assistance's IMO.

Once I learned to say, "Alexa," instead of, "Alexia," it has worked perfectly. We got it primarily for listening to music in our sun/tv room. Not for background but for actually listening. It has produced everything from, classical to jazz to country to that good old rock and roll. So far, I have only struck out on one request. Sound quality very good

reviews.reviewTitle: A lot nicer than the Gen 3 Dot
reviews.reviewText: This Echo Plus includes a built in Zigbee bridge which controls any device that requires one, such as Philips Hue bulbs. It will not give you the full function of using a Philips Hue Bridge instead but it works well for the most part. If you want to use the color changing bulbs I suggest getting a Hue Bridge. The sound is noticeable better than the Dot. Other than that it is pretty much the same as the Dot.

I have had the echo plus for about two weeks. The sound quality is not what I expected.and Alexa hasn't impressed me yet. I bought this unit to replace my google assistant and so far Alexa is not much better than the google assistent.
I'm forever changing the volume control because of the difference in many songs.
II am also surprised of the songs that I request that are not in the Amazon library. I think I have more songs than they do. Alexa doesn't appear very friendly compared to my old google assistant. I hope it gets better.

It took me a while to get used to the idea that I could ask Alexa anything! I was scrambling with converting measures in my kitchen when I suddenly remembered her and it was nice not to have to touch anything with my hands full of flour and whatever else I was using in my recipe! Now I have set up some apps and I find Alexa very helpful!

reviews.reviewTitle: Hard to beat value, great sound, and ever-expanding functionality!
reviews.reviewText: So I've had several echo dots and wanted to take the next step up to the Echo Plus, which would give me future possibilities. First thing I noticed was the unbelievable sound and clarity. Absolutely love it. Even the wife commented on it and she hates technology, ha. I quickly added colored smart bulbs, created some routines, and it all works seamlessly. Getting this on black friday deals made it a steal really.

I was very exited to discover I could have both my echos play at the same time even though one of them is one of the original models. I rated it lower on sound quality because, of course, with a small speaker there is only so much depth. I’d get the subwoofer but based on reviews, it looks like there is still some work to be done in that area first.

reviews.reviewTitle: Streaming music, setting alarms/timers, asking Alexa stuff
reviews.reviewText: I have an echo dot in the bedroom, which has been fine; and so I decided to get this bigger/newer version for the living room. It has been wonderful streaming music into the core living space of my house. Set up was basically immediate because of the dot in use; but its easy to use this device. I've decided to commit to the Amazon smart home platform, and will begin to add smart devices that I should be able to control through Alexa. We shall see. But as for this device, I love it.
Excellent sound quality. Kinda finicky connectivity with other speakers, but excellent connectivity to Wi-Fi. App must have more work done. I prefer the dial volume adjuster of the first generation.

Got this for my mom for Christmas! She love’s it! However, make sure it is ideal for you or the person because for her it quickly turned into an old gadget. Alexa gets easily confused if too many phones are paired to her. Ex: I have an iPhone with Apple Music, mom android, amazon music. Alexa sometimes has a problem with choosing which source to play from unless you tell her. If she can’t find it on Apple Music she will not automatically search amazon music which I feel is a bit bizarre. All in all, still a very great purchase!

reviews.reviewTitle: Needs a built in bridge for some smart devices
reviews.reviewText: I love the design, the sound, and the ease of setting up new devices and routines. We swapped to Alexa from google and we are glad we did! If I had any complaints at this point it would be it’s dependency on a bridge for some smart devices. Overall, very satisfied so far!

Sounds great, good mic pickup. I bought it at the reasonable price of $99, since then they added $50 to the price and I just can't justify that price as there are other better sounding Alexa speakers closer to $200 that I will get instead

reviews.reviewTitle: Loving this more than words can say
reviews.reviewText:
Best decision I ever made even tho hubby wasnt crazy over the idea of Alexa. We both are blown away! Not tech savvy here but your tech people are fabulous and patient. Shout out to tech Harold. You're a rock star in my book. We can listen to any song we want.
Goosebumps now listening to Elvis, The 2 Cellos,...
Thank you Amazon and Harold xo

Delivery and packaging were excellent. Purchased as Christmas gift and has been used off and on over the last several days so the jury is still out on some functions. I listened this afternoon as my daughter used to play music from her iPhone. Sound quality is good. Wife is very please with this device.

reviews.reviewTitle: TRYING TO GET THE ALEXA WORKING
reviews.reviewText:
I HAVE THE ALEXA WORKING NOW , BUT IT TOOK A WHILE TO DO & I AM STILL TRYING TO CONNECT WITH MY I PAD & I MAC I'VE CALLED THE HELP SEVERAL TIMES & HAVE HAD TO DISCONNECT BECAUSE COULD NOT HEAR OR UNSTAND THE PARTY AT THE OTHER END OF THE LINE . IREALY DONOT KNOW WHAT TO SAY BUT THE GETTING THE ALEXA RUNNING IS NOT A EASY THING TO DO ALSO WHEN I ASK A ? THAT ALEXA CAN NOT ANSWER IT TURNS OFF I PULL THE CORD OUT OF THE SOCKET & RE ENTER & ALEXA WORKS AGAIN I'M VERY DISAPPOINTED NOT WITH ALEXA BUT WITH THE CUSTOMER SERVICE PLEASE IMPROVE ON YOUR HELPING THE CUSTOMER.
THANK U 07/30/2019- U HAVE ANSWERED WITH A E-MAIL THAT I FOLLOWED BUT THE INFO GIVING DID NOT HELP ME RESOLVE MY PROBLEM TO GET THE ALEXA CONNECTED TO MY I MAC & I PAD PLEASE HELP THIS IS GOING ON FOR A VERY LONG TIME!! THANK U
