I love my new Echo Plus (end gen). Alexa is so convenient. I can't tell you how many times, in my life, I've sat down in my recliner to watch TV, only to realize I've left 3 lights on. Now Alexa turns them off for me! I think, in a few months, she will be controlling my whole house, including my home theater system! She can do so many things but one of the best is she can check my email. Like everyone else I get so frustrated with junk email. Now Alexa can delete them for me. Awesome produce. The ultimate in convenience...

YOU DO NOT NEED THE HUE HUB FOR BASIC LIGHT FUNCTIONS!!! Turn light on. Now turn it off and back on to put it into wifi search mode. In your Alexa app, go to "Add Device" -->"Light"--> "Phillips Hue" -->Discover Devices.... Do not download the Phillips Hue skills app unless you have the Hue Hub

The Echo plus and the Hue lights work excellent with each other!

reviews.reviewTitle: Useful for things I didn't know I needed in my life
reviews.reviewText: Alexa integration is nice, but smarthome functionality is a game changer. My kids also love asking Alexa to play music. The speaker is much improved over the gen 1 I have had since Beta. The sound is robust and deep without the rattling that would occur on the gen 1. It also looks sleek and fits right at home on my kitchen counter. If only my kids listened as well as Alexa!

This is my kitchen companion. Alexa helps me look up Wikipedia articles, remember world capitals, and keep track of multiple timers for cooking and other chores. We do quizzes (Question of the Day and jeopardy are personal favorites), phone our sons, and play music. Alexa is unfazed by repeat requests and cancellations. No judgments.
Heading had a first generation Echo, I'm loving the newer Echo Plus.

I love it I use it to pair with my iPad and watch YouTube, Netflix, Hulu, WWE Network, etc, to play music on my iPad/phone and listen to audiobooks. Also I live at home with my parents and we’ve found the feature of being able to communicate between my Echo and my parents Echo to be very useful to set alarms for the family (ex. 9:00 drop me off at church), to announce when dinner’s ready. I can definitely appreciate being able to pay it off in monthly installments. It’s beyond dope!! I also love the Echo’s music guessing game (I forget exactly what it’s called)!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t even second guess yourself, buy Echo Plus now!
reviews.reviewText: Holy sh*t balls, the Echo Plus is amazing. I was vacillating between the Echo Plus or the Apple HomePod, and I am glad I chose the Echo Plus. Does the HomePod sound better? Maybe. But the Echo Plus is a close second, and it has Alexa (Siri is low key kinda stupid). If you’re undecided about this product, please don’t be. Echo Plus is a fantastic product with an insanely great price; it’s worth every penny.

The Echo Plus is a great improvement over the standard echo or the old Plus. Love the enhanced sound and deeper bass when I play Music. Of course it still allows control over other home devices since the home hub is built in. And also Alexa sounds better too!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: The best Alexa for the money
reviews.reviewText: I would buy this hands down over the spot or echo. Wish I had this in every room instead of my dots. I have every kind of Alexa in my house and this is by far the best Alexa device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound for such a little speaker
reviews.reviewText: We got this and turned around and bought a dot for our shop both work great and its easy to communicate back and forth. The drop in feature works well to reach someone that may have their hands full. I also use mine for a hands free timer when I am in my kitchen baking. I am surprised at all the things I can use it for.

Everything you wanted in a personal assistant. I've just had mine for 3 days but I am very pleased and amazed with what you can do and I have only seen the tip of the iceberg
Fun, easy, practical, meaningful, knowledgeable. Gives new meaning to personal assistants.

reviews.reviewTitle: Make sure ya got your kids to help setup
reviews.reviewText: Once we figure it out it will be fine but at this time the only thing we have down pat is what is the weather. Having trouble connecting my smart TV which has Prime, The Alexa app has not helped much except to connect all the echo's together. It is probly my operator error but I need my kids back to figure it out or we have a 300.00 buck temperature censer?

Tried buying this after Iris went out of business with smart plugs because it had a built in hub that was supposed to connect with Alexa to work with Iris products. So disappointing!!! Could be making a ton of money!!!. Your loss!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound and voice recognition. Can whisper and it hears you!
reviews.reviewText: I've always have owned alexas. Absolutely love them but I broke my old one because the voice recognition sucked and could never understand anything without talking loud so I picked it up and sent it to its maker. Dumb move because I had to replace it with this model tbh I like alot better. Definitely has improve in all categories for sure!

Amazing sound compared to the first generation of Echos. I love her!!! love the multi room music. Tip: Think of a better group name than Everywhere. I thought that was a great group name until my husband tried to play Tim McGraw's song Everywhere. Finally had to say Echo, Play the song Everywhere by Time McGraw on the everywhere group. But if your husband doesn't like that song, Everywhere is a great group name!

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Plus (2nd Gen). Very loud combined with the echo sub
reviews.reviewText:
Echo Plus (2nd Gen)
It's sound is much better than the previous version but when hooked up to the Echo Sub it's performance degrades from mildly to seriously. I had to return the first one I bought because it had pretty much stopped working. The problem is the sub. When I unpair the Echo Plus (2nd Gen) from the Echo Sub, the Echo Plus (2nd Gen), by itself, works perfectly all the time.

The Echo product is fun and easy to use. It will I'm sure take some getting used to so all the features can be explored and used depending on need. However, Amazon Customer Service is another issue. I am not sure that Prime and it's membership cost is worth the price when having to reach and deal with them. Granted, I am learning what Amazon is all about but, the volume of emails received can be burdensome and returns are difficult to process. Multiple items received in one box will require separate return address shipping labels so that any refund will accurately reflect the total price paid.

reviews.reviewTitle: A capable upgrade to the Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Plus functions much the same as my Echo Dots. I didn't find any real improvement in voice recognition or integration. The sound is marginally better than the Echo Dot's with deeper base but it tends to distort progressively at volumes above level 8. The device is heavier than I had expected it to be but the footprint isn't any large save for the vertical creep on the design. I did find it was just a bit too heavy for the outlet shelf I had used previously for an Echo Dot in the same room.

This is a great unit for listening to music around the house. Good sound quality, good base. You can build speaker groups with other Echo devices. Has 3.5m speaker input/output - toggled through the Alexa App. Has excellent voice recognition, much better than an Echo Dot, which has no problem itself. The device is quality and looks good also. Great Echo device.

I really like having the ease of Alexa telling me the temperature, the time, and playing what I want whenever I want to hear it. My husband, who complains about sound quality on most radios, has not complained about the sound. I am not certain I like having to pay extra for Amazon Music but she hasn't told me the can't find anything I ask her to play since I started the subscription.

Definitely not worth the money. The sound is not very good. Compared to echo plus 1st gen, this new echo plus really falls short on every single aspect. Bass, vocals, plus it was a hassle to set up to begin with.
Really disappointed as I really had high expectations for this.
Returned after a day.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better. But still room for improvement.
reviews.reviewText: Alexa still could use improvement in the voice recognition area. Needs to be able to accept regular speech patterns better. I'm sure that will come in time. Adding it to the network was simple through the alexa app. For its size, the audio is good. An onboard battery would make the speaker better. Don't look forward to spending more to add that functionality.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overprice and not much improvement from Echo Dot 3rd Gen
reviews.reviewText: Basically, the Echo Plus is a bigger version of Echo Dot 3rd Gen and they are only good for casual listening but if you are expecting more Bass than you will still need to connect to the subwoofer or another audio system you have at home. In fact I have 2 echo dots and 1 echo plus and I love all of them but for the price difference, I would say the echo dot 3rd gen will be a better choice and buying a separate Smart Home hub instead of the Echo Plus. Looks wise, I like the echo dots better but is individual preference.....

This little speaker is a jem. The sound quality is down right astonishing. Very tempted to go purchase the echo subwoofer to pair with them. Built in home hub makes things super easy to get into the Alexa control environment. Great little speaker well worth the money spent.

Update!!! Well I did it the echo sub is the perfect addition to the speakers the sound is amazing I AM LOVING THIS!!!

I have 3 dots and two echo pluses...while the sound on the plus is louder, it’s incredibly muddy/muffled on both and the worst part is how poor alexa works on these units...I will ask alexa to play a song and she will sometimes not respond for a couple minutes or I have even had her play on another speaker on the far side of the house. I never have any problems with my dots.

I upgraded to this model from my original echo specifically because of the built in hub. It easily recognized all my lights and allowed me to get rid of my old hub that kept losing connectivity several times a day. So far it has worked perfectly and was very easy to set up. The sound quality is better than the old echo and I haven’t had any problems with it at all.

I have several Echo 3rd generation, I enjoy them very much especially listening to music, so I finally decided to upgrade to the Echo Plus. The sound is fantastic for the size, much more bass, in a attractive unit.. The only downside is the microphones. most times I have to repeat my self several times. I listen to a show on Volley FM I ask Alexa to open it, I get an error noise. I try several times speaking clearly and even enunciate, I will get the error noise or no response at all and this is standing within three feet of the Echo Plus

I BOUGHT THIS BECAUSE I LISTEN TO AUDIBLE AND UNTIL NOW I MISSED 1/2 THE DIALOGUE DUE TO MY POOR HEARING. WITH THIS ECHO I'M GETTING 95% OF THE DIALOGUE. I TOOK A CHANCE ON BUYING THIS, BUT IT PAID OFF. THIS ECH IS A HUGE IMPROVEMENT OVER PREVIOUS ECHO'S AND THAT SAYS A LOT BECAUSE I THOUGHT THE PREVIOUS ECHO'S WERE VERY GOOD. TO HAVE FRANK SINATRA AT MY INSTANT COMMAND IN IT SELF MADE ECHO WORTH WHILE.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easier to set up than Sonos one
reviews.reviewText: Love this and want two more. We had a Sonos one for about a week and ended up returning it. The sound was never quite right and set up was difficult and I’m pretty good with that stuff. My husband said “if you’re having trouble setting it up then it must be difficult” I can’t compare sound because we could never get the sound right with the other but the sound on this is incredible. Admittedly I’m no audiophile but nonetheless I know basic good quality sound and this is far superior for less than Sonos one

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Speaker Quality For My Home
reviews.reviewText: These speakers are perfect for my home. The sound quality works great for me as I have speakers hooked up everywhere I go. They integrate perfectly with Alexa and I have several networks set up. I use them constantly and don’t know what I did before setting up my system. Kept adding speakers and now have music both upstairs and throughout the first floor and in the kitchen. For me this is exactly what I needed to get back to music again.

reviews.reviewTitle: How did I ever live without you, Alexa!
reviews.reviewText: This is my first Alexa device. I have been blown away with all of the things Alexa can do for me. When you add the smart plugs and bulbs it is so much fun just telling different appliances and electronics to turn on and off with just your voice. Sound quality of the Echo Plus is great. I decided on the plus edition because it has the hub built in. Definitely the right choice. Just get it, it is great !!!

I only use Echo Plus for music. I bought two so I could pair them for stereo and they sound pretty good. If you're comparing them to $500 speakers with 8" woofers, then they will come up short, but for casual listening, I am very happy. Another benefit of buying the Echo unit is that you get Amazon Music for 1/2 price.

I have several Dots and decided to buy my first Echo Plus a couple of months ago. Loved it so much I bought a second one! The sound is great and it's a stylish design. I don't even use my Bluetooth speaker in one of my rooms because the Echo Plus sound is super clear and crisp. The microphone seems to respond a bit better as well. I'll likely end up buying a third!

I've had the Echo since it was first introduced, and I was always a bid fan, but thought the sound quality was just okay. I recently replaced my first generation with an Echo Plus and added the Echo Sub-Woofer and the sound quality is Top-Notch. Big improvement. Set up and pairing accessories was quick and easy.

My Echo Plus is in my living room. It's a nice size and fits well into the room. I wanted it for listening to music, turning on & dimming lights, as well as checking time, temperature, etc.. I have an Echo Spot on my desk (very handy when you need to know how to spell a word), and an Echo Show in my bedroom (replaced the clock radio). I have it where music plays on all three and it's a great stereo effect.

I can't believe I didn't buy this product sooner. My husband and I use this every day. Alexa answers all our questions, sets times, makes list and plays music for us. We receive emails with tips of other functions the Echo Plus can do. We also received a light bulb that works with the Echo Plus, so Alexa can turn on and off a lamp for us. I highly recommend this product!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Gen 2 big improvement to Gen 1
reviews.reviewText: I have delayed replacing my Echo Gen 1, even after hearing the sound improvement from the Dot gen 2. This may sound silly, but when I realized I could unplug the Dot and relocate it without having to sync it with my network again, that changed my mind. The price was a bit more than I wanted to spend, but when I found out that Amazon gives you a credit if you return your Gen 1 product, I was sold. The quality is excellent

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product, software still needs work
reviews.reviewText: T the new echo is pretty amazing but not quite prefect yet. The hardware is great but it still seems limited by somewhat buggy software. Audio quality is so much better than the first Gen and is flat out spectacular when paired with the echo subwoofer. Set up is a breeze just as it is with all echo devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon echo is top of the line
reviews.reviewText: Amazon Echo- What else do you need to say? This is the most amazing product available right now in the market. My wife and I moved over to an Echo driven home and this has changed our life for the better. I recommend getting set up now with an Echo/Alexa integrated home, as this is the next step in technology- similar to getting a home computer in the late 1980's before the transition

The Echo Plus (2nd Gen) is a great product. The voice recognition is very good. I had trouble before with my daughter's Echo with voice recognition since I have an accent and Alexa did not recognize what I was asking. My kids use to laugh because of this. Integrating my lights, door lock and thermostat was very easy. The sound quality is very good. Up until now I recommend this product.

Would not connect to our wifi network. It only wanted to set up it's own new wifi network. After setting up it's own network it could not find an internet connection. We were excited to get our Echo Plus and we were equally disappointed that it would not function. Also, foreign customer service did not have the capacity or training to help and understand our issue. They did however know how to complete the return process

reviews.reviewTitle: I replaced my original units with Echo Plus
reviews.reviewText: The built-in hub is perfect. Your new wall plugs work with this thing to make home automation, quick and nearly foolproof. It sounds better also......I enjoy sleeping by the ocean every night (the much more realistic sound than the original units). I just installed the Ring 2 doorbell/camera and it announces motion thru my Echo Plus even if no one rings the bell. LOVE IT

I bought an Echo plus, came with a light bulb. Took no time to set it up, download the app to my phone and get it up and running too less than 10 minutes. Love being able to turn on the lights, from my car, as I get home. The sound blows my mind, sounds so good. I also love the drop in program, where I can get into contact with anyone in my house, without having to call them on the phone.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's amazing... except when it's not
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Plus has superior sound quality to the Echo and I love it's functionality. That said it's functionality is not always intuitive and for some reason it keeps sounding off with an unsolicited alarm at random times and won't stop unless we yell "Alexa STOP". This is very unnerving for our pets and we can't figure out how to make it stop as Alexa won't even acknowledge what the alert is for and I can't go into the device and find a list of anything.

reviews.reviewTitle: A little confusing to pair the woofer with the echo but got it working and it is wonderful.
reviews.reviewText: The best money I EVER spent on a music system and the ONLY one I will EVER need. If you love music and a quality sound, you MUST have the ECHO second generation and the subwoofer. Just FABULOUS! Now I can sell all of my CD'S. I won't be needing them anymore. I played two songs(Blurred Lines and I Gotta Feeling) and my wife and I just looked at each other and smiled. UNBELIEVABLE.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good sounds. Fails to execute. Annoying by continually promoting Amazon Music
reviews.reviewText: Good sounds but sometimes it doesn’t respond, or loses connections to the internet, voice recognition, or music and lights. Even though i don’t say “Amazon Prime Music,” it will insists on promoting and playing it. By doing so, I will not subscribe to Amazon Music because they’re shoving it into my ears.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa definitely needs work but the system itself has AMAZING sound!
reviews.reviewText: The sound is incredible and I bought this for music in the house and its amazing! Alexa still has some bugs and I guess I want her to be more informative but she is still very basic for some reason. With todays technology, one would think that this would be an incredible experience. But, as far as the sound system itself, it ROCKS!

I decided to go with the echo plus as my first Alexa device and do not regret purchasing it. The connivence and sound quality that it offers are great for the size of the speaker and price point. I paired the plus with my Philips Hue lights and amazon smart plug and they work great together. I will admit that it is a little hit and miss at times but nothing too frequent. I wish the bass was a little deeper after being maxed out in the app but at that point I’d just be complaining about non sense given the size of the unit. If you are looking for an amazon Alexa device and have the money to spend, then I would definitely recommend this too you.

I use this for music, weather reports, shopping list, etc., I bought the battery backup so I can just unplug and take the unit with me to play music outdoors.. On the Fourth of July, I had it outside and during the fireworks finale, I asked it to play the Star Spangled Banner. It was great. Sound is great, great great.

I like the additional pickup microphones, the Speakers/Sound quality, and the Look is High Quality. Received a great deal with the promotion and the trade-in of our Gen. One unit. Zigbee hub, for me is of no value. (thus the four star overall) Z-Wave would have been more helpful. (to me) Or next time include a Wink Hub inside, and then you will rock with all the protocols. For my Net Cost...I'm Good!

reviews.reviewTitle: Interesting, but not at all necessary so far
reviews.reviewText: Still getting used to ths idea, not really necessary in my life, and I do worry about the Big Brother aspect. Do enjoy the music and like the voice activated lightbulb. Still trying some other features but do not want to give access to my phone contact list. I get annoyed about the yellow light indicating a notification is available - usually an Amazon pkg I have already retrieved.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty cool could be better. But I'm happy with it.
reviews.reviewText: It's pretty cool. The sound could have been a little better but it's not too bad. I wish it had more abilities to control my Samsung curved TV but I have to buy something else for that to happen. I like the way it turns on and off the Hue Lights I haven't really got a lot of stuff for it to interact with yet. I'm not an apple person but I think their product is better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good. Hoping for more features in the future.
reviews.reviewText: As expected. Hoping for continued development as the market for smart tech develops. Control over everything is hard with so many brands trying to choose the right team to play with, but my hope is that as the market settles Alexa will continue to stay compatible with other major brands to make a more unified experience for everyone. Overall it’s a brilliant device and seems to have changed my life’s routine for the better.

The new Eco Plus (2nd Gen) sounds better then the 1st Gen and it’s appearance is more pleasing. It also comes equipped with a built-in Zigbee smart hub which facilitate basic control of others smarts home devices such as hue lights or Samsung SmartThings devices without requiring an separate hub. To take advantage of all the functionality of your SmartThing devices you would be required to install the device hub and download the corresponding app. The 2nd Gen basically performs all functions that the 1st Gen performs, just with a better look and sound and may not need separate hubs depending on your requirements.

reviews.reviewTitle: Randomly starts playing music during the night
reviews.reviewText: I like the sound but there are bugs Amazon needs to fix. It randomly starts playing music during the night so I had to start unplugging it before I went to bed. Plus it will suddenly stop music while playing. I Googled this problem and apparently it is a common problem. So, I had to return it. When Amazon gets these bugs fixed I will buy it again.

reviews.reviewTitle: You should have purchased it yesterday
reviews.reviewText: Other than getting the wrong color...this steroids setup is incredible...much closer to audiophile sound than the Googke Max, Apple Home or the Sonos Speakers

I’m so happy I bought it! There is just so much it has to offer. We’ve added a bunch of skills and games. I love that I can ask what my daughters blood sugars are, it can help me find my phone, daily weather, play music drop in, and answer questions. I have not added any other smart home connections yet.
The only think that I think may be improved is the sound is great at a low to moderate level, but if you list to it loud the bass becomes a little faded. But, still not bad just not great. I would still totally buy it again.

This replaces our original Echo. I like it better. It looks good and has some surprises built in, like a way to measure the room temperature. I can tell how hot or cold my living room is from the middle of the Caribbean on a cruise ship. The audio is improved from the first edition but will not be satisfactory for audiophiles.

I like the new Echo Plus so much I bought a second one so I could have paired stereo speakers. The sound is great, much better than the original Echo it replaced. A little more stylish looking, too, which just makes it a bit nicer sitting on the table. Set up was a breeze. I already had Hue lights and the Hue hub, but everything integrated in a flash. Overall, I'd recommend it, very pleased.

Quite the upgrade from the Echo Dot 3 of which I have several. Amazing sound. It has extra microphones so Alexa can hear you better, too. My wife is handicapped, so having a hub built in to control lights and the front door lock is a big deal. Set up is amazingly easy. Just ask Alexa to find devices. Matched with Amazon Music Unlimited, it is a paradigm shift.

reviews.reviewTitle: Annoying Amazon Ads, but okay aside from that
reviews.reviewText: I bought this unit only to play music from Amazon. Every time I request a song, Alexa tells me it is playing music from my Amazon Music Library. Request 5 songs a day or more and this gets annoying (Amazon Music over and over like commercial stuck on repeat) , hence the 3 star rating. It does work okay for setting timers, and playing music. I use my Google device for other tasks as Alexa really is behind the curve with speech recognition.

At first i loved this and couldn't wait to use it all the time, now only after about a week, she doesn't seem to recognize my voice very well and when i tell her to do things she doesn't - for instance turn the music off - i have to tell her like 10 times to do it before she does. i hope this straightens itself out or updates if possible.
Alexa advertises that you get unlimited music selections with your purchase.. not true. Anything that is worth listening to you have to buy. Very disappointed. Returned the entire package

The marketing gave the impression that having the plus would free me of the need to have a hue hub. It doesn't. I'm really not sure what the plus gets me. I'm a little bit of a audophile but I can't really tell any significant improvement in sound from the echo 1st gen to the plus 2nd. Disappointing.

Alexa gets better every day. The sound quality is not quite as good as the Apple HomePod, but at 1/4 the cost it’s a much better deal. You can buy two of these plus a handful of Echo Dots for the cost of one HomePod and fill your whole house with smart music. Just buy it now and thank me later.

Within the first 15 minutes of setting up my Echo Plus (my first Echo/Alexa device), I thought "I don't really need this... I'll probably return it." Twenty minutes later, I was ordering an Echo Dot for upstairs. It works great with my Hue lights and Sonos, I love that it announces the arrivals of my Amazon orders, and all the music/sound playlist options with Amazon Music.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you want it, get it. You won’t disappointed.
reviews.reviewText: Overall I am very pleased with my purchase. Alexa is amazing and has so many skills. I find myself using the bot more often than I thought I would. She knows extracto who is talking and will base her answers on that. Her speaker is so perfect and the Bluetooth is spot on. Sometimes she’ll lag but that really depends on how fast your WiFi is. Make sure your devices have built in hub! That’s a biggie! The only down side to alexa would have to be is knowing how to ask her questions accurately. If you have a question try and keep it short and simple. But that’s about it. She’s a great addition to my home and has made my life a lot more easier! 5/5 overall.

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple setup, great sound and very useful
reviews.reviewText: Like all Echo products the setup is super simple to connect it. I have a 1st generation Echo and the quality of sound, not to mention the esthetics of the device, are so much better. Hooking up smart devices to the hub is super simple through the Alexa app also as I have replaced most of the light switches in the house with connected Lutron digital switches.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as loud of sound that I was expecting
reviews.reviewText: I have the original version and the sound is better. Perhaps the quality of the sound is a litter better on this model but I have to turn it up almost to the max to really hear the music. Especially when I'm clanking around in the kitchen. If I were to buy another Echo, it'd be the first gen.

reviews.reviewTitle: GREAT sound, very responsive, awesome product
reviews.reviewText: My husband and I bought the first-gen Echo model fairly early on, but the 2nd Gen Echo Plus is even better. The sound quality is fantastic, she hears me even when I'm in another room, and her programming keeps getting better and better (she can now answer MANY more questions than the 1st Gen could, and she's clever about it). Very satisfied with this product, and only beginning to explore what she can do.

I love this! I purchased it for my elderly parents then bought one for myself.
My father's hearing is poor. The speaker is so clear that he can hear perfectly when he is speaking ti his grandsons. He also has macular degeneration. If he wants to know the weather all he has to do is ask!

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds great and works great with my lights
reviews.reviewText: We are just starting into the home automation world and decided to build it off of the Echo Plus. Right now we only have a handful of lights that can be controlled with the Echo Plus. Set up was really simple and it works great. I've added some routines to control the lights. That interface on the app is simple and works great. We also signed up for amazon music unlimited. The sound quality from the Echo Plus is excellent. We are really happy with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: great with dots in the other rooms
reviews.reviewText: This does a great job for controlling smart devices in the house, but the best part is the "drop in". set your security options and with dots located in the other rooms of the house we have an intercom and no longer have to yell! This one sounds way better than the dots but if you like listening to loud music with lots of bass you will need more.

For $3.99 a month you can subcribe to Amazon music. Sound quality is very good. Its not the best, I had better speakers before, but for its size the sound is very good. It also controls the lights for us. It never fail to understand our instructions. Super easy to use. We use it every day.

PROS:
Alexa is fun to interact with.
Great audio quality.
it can hear my commands from a distance or with background noise.
I added some skills to it, including controlling some light in the apartment.

CONS:
None so far

I’m so in love with my Echo plus and Alexa! Got the Philips Hue light bulbs for living room, bedroom, and spare room and they work like a charm. We set up routines for morning and bedtime and they help so much. Playing games, dropping in on my mom, playing music is a breeze, even asked Alexa for synonyms while doing homework. I use my echo plus every single day, multiple times a day and it has made my life much easier, and more entertaining. Get one right now!

reviews.reviewTitle: Still learning all it can do
reviews.reviewText: So my neighbor received a dot for Christmas and I decided to try one of them. I ended up with two Echo plus. Added a sub and the music sounds good. Add the Alexa app to your phone or tablet and you can change music and volume when the music is playing. I'm controlling my smart thermostat and lights. I'm still finding out about new features and apps for echo. Happy so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good but networking / multi-room use is a challenge.
reviews.reviewText:
Overall enjoy having the Echo. The difficulty is in playing music in more than one room. I've set this up several times, looked at posts online with others having the same problem but still can't get it to work. I set up a Sonos system for someone that was much easier and worked perfectly in just a few minutes. I'm sure I'll figure it out when I get the time.

Fun to have and the more I learn how to use it the better it gets.

Overall I had purchased at least 5 devices for my self and I’m very dissspointed with Alexa’s capability of understanding simple questions, tasks, skills, etc. It’s so annoying to pay so much for a product and it not work even close to perfect. One of my worst investments to date. I hope to come back and update this with more detail.

reviews.reviewTitle: echosystem, works well, good sounds, looks good
reviews.reviewText: i have an echo, echo dot and echo plus - the echo plus is the nicest sounding, enough bass - but i love how all the echo products are getting better and better at voice recognition, rapid smart responses, etc. i use it mainly for music and weather alerts, and timers so good enough for me

it's just awesome!! very loud and nice bass, always hears you and acts accordingly,
I also have the Echo and the Plus sounds way way better and louder - 2 can fill my Living room easily.
I love the fact that it contains a temp sensor (I didn't know that before I opened it).

reviews.reviewTitle: I’m all in with Amazon and Alexa
reviews.reviewText: I’m glad I went with Amazon and Alexa, there are quite a few spud choices out there, but the sound quality, functionality, and look of the Amazon family of devices stand out from the pack. I am looking forward to expanding the automation beyond the thermostat and few electrical sockets. I’m very excited and pleased with my purchase. What are you waiting for, dive on in, you won’t be sorry!

My daughter got an echo dot for her birthday and I found myself missing it when she would take it out of our living room, so I needed my own. Sound quality is excellent, love the notifications when my packages arrive, Alexa is very attenitive, and we can listen to pretty much all whatever we have on our mind. Alexa’s jokes aren’t bad either;)

I love this technology and how easy it is to use. I can ask to play all sorts of music and get basic information like weather, news, etc. Much easier than selecting my music from my CD's to manually put on my CD player or tune in a radio station. It is terrific and don't know how I would go back to not using it. So many options on this device. Thank you.

Loved that this Echo is able to integrate with my other Echo's right out of the box. It linked itself and was ready to go out of the box. I had to move a couple of integrated systems from my old 1st generation echo plus over to this new one, but that was easy on my smart phone. Sound is very good. Would I buy this again? You bet!
The features are good and everything works great but for the size/Price it has, I would expexted a better sound quality because the difference with the Echo Dot (3er Generation) is not that much.

reviews.reviewTitle: really nice music to my ears
reviews.reviewText: this unit replaces last years model with a trade in i thought id give it a try. yes the sound is richer and the unit itself a little heftier so it makes it a little more stable sitting on the shelf. it connected seamlessly to my wi-fi and controls my living room lamp so no more busting my toe on furniture early mornings in the dark. thumbs up again amazon love these gadgets

We're streamlining all of our audio and video as we upgrade our home to a smart home. LOVE the echo plus - we now have echo's in nearly all of our rooms - can stream music on all, control lights, get information - truly makes our lives a little easier. We did have to upgrade our DSL speed - but it was only a few dollars a month and it's made life SO much easier!

I love how my Echo Plus can add an event to my shopping list or to my calendar with just a voice command. My husband loves AM radio and it is getting harder and harder to find radios that broadcast AM so instead we bought an Echo Plus. I can get today's weather and traffic to work too. Really glad we purchased this. What took us so long?

Works very well, although having trouble getting multiple devices to play music at same time as Alexa does not seem to understand request to play multiroom after it has been programmed in.

Had to take two stars off due to failure of delivery person to put package at safe/secure location as requested. Even took picture to show that they failed to deliver to proper place.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not compatible with other new generation Alexa
reviews.reviewText: I have over 10 alexa devices in my house and up until now I have been happy. But now not all all happy. I recently invested in the new Alexa Show and the new Alexa Subwoofer and after watching the Alexa video showing how you can pair the new generation Alexa devices to make stereo sound I purchase the new Echo Plus and now I find out when trying to pair the three together that the devices are not all compatible. Called Amazon support and no help in resolving the issue. I really do expect more from Amazon than this. I am a very unhappy customer.

reviews.reviewTitle: hope you get a good spreaker
reviews.reviewText: Out of four speakers only one is working correctly. Two were sent back because the code Alexa had did not not match the serial number on the speaker. The other speaker the auto in setting does not work. Love the speaker and sound, but there are still some technical bugs in the system. Would expect more from Amazon.

I purchased this to complement Alexa Dot devices in my home and it seems like a good buy. If you already have Alexa set-up on your system you basically just need to plug it in and you are ready. Works well but I wish the speaker was a bit better as it distorts if you try to get any loud volume out of it.

Got it for my parents for Christmas and my dad said, "I can blare Metallica so loud on this thing". They were also able to easily connect it with their Bose speakers and overhead random brand of speaker to play music throughout the house. I was happy to hear it was easy for them to sync and control their various devices since they're not the most tech savvy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Will not connect with all versions of Bluetooth
reviews.reviewText: description says "will not connect with Bluetooth 3.5". I have a MP3 with Bluetooth 4.2 and will not connect. I think the description should state "3.5 and newer". Very disappointing since I wanted to Bluetooth my music to the Echo PLus. Other than it it is just "OK" since I really feel it is not "fully functional" as a speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very nice sound! And so much more
reviews.reviewText: I haven’t updated my in home music devices since the 90’s, waiting for an affordable good looking solution. This is it! I can ask for whatever style music suits me, and more! The monthly music subscription is cheaper than a CD, to whichever service. I may purchase one for my parents.. in their 70’s, they would love the sound quality, and added features.

Got this on sale and I'm glad I did. The sound is so much better than my first gen Echo. The bass fills up the room. I'm sure whoever lives upstairs doesn't like the sound as much as I do. Works great with the smart lightbulb too. Put the old Echo in the bedroom and now it's great to be able to say "Alexa, play RadioHab on TuneIn, everywhere" and I can listen to my music literally everywhere in the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: I nice improvement over the Original!
reviews.reviewText: Aesthetically, this looks great. The shorter stature and fabric casing is very nice and pleasant to look at. The sound is great. I haven't had the need to use the hub yet because I have a bunch of wi-fi plugs that do not need one. The added mics are very good - 7 on the new model vs 1 on the original. I am very happy with the upgrade, and purchased 3 3rd gen dots as well.

The sound is OK but certainly not three times as good as the the newer dots... maybe 25% better. Voice recognition is not as good as the dot. It seldom will respond if the TV is playing or other non-Alexa sounds are present. That being said, Alexa and Echo are still awesome and enhance my life on a daily basis.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound quality especially the bass!
reviews.reviewText: I have the first generation Alexa and enjoy listening to music from it. When I got the Alexa 2nd generation I couldn't believe the sound quality difference. The new 2nd generation Alexa music quality is fantastic. The bass sounds like it is coming out of a subwoofer. I have not used the hub yet, but that will be next. Th sound quality is almost the same as my Bose Radio.

I give a 5 star because Alexa is so much fun. I like she turns the light on and off - I like the weather report and time just for asking. Still learning how to ask questions in a way she understands. Amazon is great at sending me more ways to take advantage of Alexa’s ability. The sound quality is good - fine for my bedroom where I have her.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is my new best friend!
reviews.reviewText: I ordered the package containing one smart bulb and after a week I had my entire house hooked up. I did end up ordering a dot for the back bedroom. It’s the only place where the speaker sometimes cannot hear me but it’s past a kitchen and down a long hall. I’m extremely happy with my purchase!

Echo Plus in living room and 2 Echo Dots in bedroom (either side of bed). It's now my alarm. When alarm goes off I can tell it to stop, then ask for the weather, and then to start playing music (on all of the Echos) all without getting out from under my warm covers. Also, Just as I was going out the door this morning I told Alexa (Echo Plus) to place prebiotics in my cart for me to order. It went through my order history, found the prebiotics I've bought before, and placed it in my cart. So cool.

reviews.reviewTitle: Aux Line In Does Not Work UPDATED
reviews.reviewText: EDIT: Ok, so the Line In DOES work...but only with the Android app at this time. iOS and Amazon have relationship issues, which is not a big deal. It’s a very nice speaker and now that we can use the line in, it’s a multi-functional unit. -1 star for the hassle of figuring this all out, but it works as intended and our son loves hasselling Alexa.

We replaced the Google mini with her and we have now switched back to the Google mini. Alexa doesn't listen, hears something completely different than what we said and can't look up anything. We had our nest thermostat linked and she wouldn't control it. We can ask her about the weather, the time and brief news; outside of that she is a glorified speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: It needs improvement on a few simple things.
reviews.reviewText: Mine always says I have songs streaming another devise and the app kinda sucks. Pls fix this issue I love protect but its very frustrating. Also pls give me a way to use the subwoofer beside only with Amazon music. Its like I have to trick to come on by starting a song then quickly switch to sleep sounds.

I have 5 Echos in operation. 1st gen Dot is junk. 2nd generation Dot has much improved microphones. 1st gen Echo is pretty good though it sometime acts like a teenager and doesn't "feel" like listening at times. Tap is great during the summer when I take it outside on the porch. However, my 2nd gen Plus is, by far, the slickest gizmo yet. It's microphones are excellent. It has close to high quality sound all by itself though it can be boomy. The built-in Zigbee hub makes it worth even more to me. I now have smart bulbs everywhere. At $119 on sale it can't be beat.

reviews.reviewTitle: Received this as a gift! We are enjoying the many different features of this product!
reviews.reviewText: This is so much fun to use! We received it as a gift and never realized how much you can actually do with it! The music is great!
So far I like it, sound quality is good. Still a little weird that it is alway listening, I know it is only to activate with the key word but...... how would it hear if it was not listening.
Much better sound quality than 1st generation and the hub certainly helps keep my wi-fi unclogged. Eager for 3rd generation... hoping for something with a bit more volume

I was very disappointed to find out that this new Echo Plus is not compatible with my 1st Gen Echo Plus. I wanted to pair the speakers to play in different rooms and it is not possible. Very disappointed. On the positive side, the new 2nd Gen Echo Plus looks great and sounds better than the earlier model.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo plus great sound. Doesn’t pair simultaneously with standard echo and sub.
reviews.reviewText: Four stars because I like the sound but minus one because you can’t add two different types of echos with the echo sub at the same time. Two Like kind echos only sync simultaneously with the new echo sub. Epic fail for a technology company.

My mother's Echo suddenly stopped being able to access my playlists. It plays the artists, albums, songs, but can't find any playlists. My mother has no music in the nursing home because something changed on Amazon Music, but so far, tech supports can't figure it out.

New to me and I'm still working out kinks. Have to speak very distinctly many words or Alexa can't understand. That should work out over time. One very important action that is lacking is the ability to turn on something and specify how long it is to be on. That can be done using third party stuff like SmartThings, but that's extra steps and cash.

Love the ease of use and all the things it can do! I ask for a song and it plays. My new grandson is 11 months old and just said his first word "Leka". He pointed at the Echo and since he can't say Alexa, said Leka. His mother, my daughter, was not pleased. It was hysterical! Love using it.

Comes in handy for quick answers to most questions instead of having to look up on the internet. Need to to know the what the weather is going to be? Just ask Alexa. It can tell you a story, play 20 questions, take you on an adventure through the magic door and much more. There are some things it cannot answer, but it is getting upgraded periodically and you have to make sure you speak clearly. The only reason for giving it a 4 star is because I'm having an issue with it communicating with my Directv receiver. Keeps telling me "I'm having trouble communicating with Directv. Check you devices network and power supply." It was working when I first connected it.

The instructions for set up were easy. I made them difficult because I was in a hurry. Instructions are voice activated and then you download the Alexa app and continue with the app instructions.

I am loving the music catalogue. I’m finding that Alexa cannot understand commands for Spanish titled sound tracks. You have to enunciate as if you were saying the song in an American accent incorrectly rather than with a Spanish pronunciation. Cracks me up!

Being home all day, Alexa has become invaluable. I save time looking up things. I can see who is at my door without having to use stairs. I love when I greet "her" in the morning and she relates some interesting fact about the day or date.
She also encourages you to get your day going on a positive note.

The part I have found most frustrating is learning how to use it. I easily paired it to my iphone but could not figure out how to get it to play the music on my phone...maybe it can't....but that does not seem right. So I have to think it is me and I just don't know how to do it.....but the sound is amazing.

reviews.reviewTitle: I can't believe I waited so long
reviews.reviewText: I am completely sold on Alexa now. I’m a cord cutter so it probably benefits me even more than most. I’m so happy that I can finally listen to ESPN shows and all the live national news broadcasts that I’ve been missing for so long. Not to mention all of the classical music I could ever need. Very happy I made the purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: if you have the right tv
reviews.reviewText:
I got this to use as a Bluetooth speaker for my mom's tv. She is hard of hearing and hasn't been able to really hear the TV well in years. I also got a Bluetooth transmitter to plug into the audio output of the TV to connect.

The problem was it doesn't work that way. when connected to the Bluetooth adapter it tried to send audio TO the tv instead of take it from the TV.

As luck would have it the TV broke and they got a replacement from best buy because of the warranty. They got a new Sony TV that had Bluetooth, and I was able to pair it to the TV with no issue. My mom has said its the best she has heard the TV in the last 5 years.

I thoroughly enjoy this echo! I got it the echo plus on a discount during the Black Friday sales. The setup was very easy and quick. Since I got the echo plus, I ended up getting a fire tv and the Phillips hue lights so that Alexa can control those devices as well. The plus feature makes it where I don’t need a hub for the lights which makes it perfect. Definitely one of the best purchases I’ve made.

This listens better than my wife and children Geese.. AMAZON: PLEASE LET US CHOOSE OUR OWN WAKE WORDS... and then it would be prefect!.

Sound quality is pretty good and tends to pick up my request from literally across the room.
Would recommend this for sure.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun, easy and makes life a little easier.
reviews.reviewText: Received ECHO Plus for Christmas. Love it. Ended up buying two of the dots and one more smart plug, to go along with it. Also received four of the smart bulbs and I am more than happy with everything. I know there is more I can do with it, but for now..... I am happy with basic set up. I can request music, lights on and off, ask questions, etc.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Plus (2nd Gen) includes a hub. My Lutron dimmer now needs a Lutron hub!
reviews.reviewText: I updated an Echo to an Echo Plus (2nd Gen). My original Echo was used to control a Lutron dimmer switch and worked fine. I see now that the new Echo (advertised as built-in smart hub) and compatible with Lutron. I expected it to work without any additional hardware but now I see I "need a Lutron Hub" to interface between Echo Plus and the dimmer. Why did my original Echo work w/o a hub? Hub's additional ~$100! Not worth it to upgrade.

I am really enjoying my ECHO. I was concerned when I read reviews of people having issues streaming their Sirius radio. I had problems at first with this, however, it had to do with Sirius and nor Amazon Echo. I had to link the Sirius account to my Alexa app and there was an issue getting logged in. Then Sirius said I didn’t have streaming option available so I had to make a tech ticket with them. Long story short, after they finally called, the issue was resolved. I was able to set up Sirius as my default music and immediately started streaming.

reviews.reviewTitle: What does the plus stand for?
reviews.reviewText: Really was hoping the sound quality was going to be better. Just a hair better than 3gen Echo and still behind 1gen Echo. I have multiple Echo set up around the house for music and on the fence about sending the plus back. Don't waste the money over a plain Echo Gen3.

I have been enjoying this so far! It hears me every time even when at full volume. It does have good sound, it fills my kitchen with music and I can hear it down the hall and in the living room. It's not audiophile loud but it's very good! The more I talk to it the better Alexa is getting to know me. I would recommend.
Much improved sound. Great that it can pair. Good without sub, great with.
Ok, I got this for the hub, but also to play pandora because the Bluetooth on my sound bar is wonky. However, the sound quality is NOT good - were it not for the hub, it'd be on its way back now.

I was on the fence about buying one of these for years due to privacy issues. I am still concerned about that, but at this point the convenience outweighs the concerns. I mainly bought it for using it as a speaker in my living room and it hasn't disappointed. I got a good deal on it too.

reviews.reviewTitle: She's part of our family now
reviews.reviewText: We are having a lot of fun playing with this device. But there is one little problem, I keep worrying about hurting her feelings when I rudely say "Alexa, stop" or give her abrupt orders. And I feel like I'm rude when I don't say "thanks" for the great job she does.

reviews.reviewTitle: Won’t play Apple Music like it should
reviews.reviewText: The main reason I bought it was to play Apple Music via Alexa. It doesn’t work. Every time I try, “play (someone) on Apple Music” she then pauses for about 5 seconds as says, “I’m sorry but I can’t do that right now”. I’ve updated her software, made sure my settings & location were all correct (for the Echo Plus, the Alexa app and my Apple Music account). I’M RATHER PISSED OFF ABOUT IT!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: When you’re looking for the best look to echo plus
reviews.reviewText:
Exceptional quality and performance the Dolby sound is exquisite and the capacity is that the echo plus has to interconnect with other items is exceptional.

Strongly recommend getting the five hour battery pack that helps make the echo plus quite distinguishing looking and the mobility of taking it anywhere you want a listing to five hours of quality music

The weather isn’t available on my territory even when the address has been input correctly more than once. The music plug in to Spotify stops after 4-5 songs have played. Alexa app freezes and settings/instructions sometimes are not clear. Will still try to get uaed to it and give it more time to get to know it’s features better. It has only been a week. Other than that sound quality is good and voice recognition as well. It’s a bummer it doesn’t have an internal battery so it can be moved from place to place easily.

reviews.reviewTitle: Its ok. I was expecting to be wowed.
reviews.reviewText: It's nice. A little better then the second generation. For sound that is. I like that it has its own temperature built in. And I love the light bulb that came with it. However the light ring on top of the device seems dim and you can see the individual lights. And the music dose cut out when the other second generation keeps going with the music. Seems a little odd. Especially when it cost considerably more.

Good sound and nice looking device.
Best part that’s it has a built in smart hub; and it’s Wifi. My previous SamsungThings hub was only Ethernet.
The only thing stopping me from giving it a 5 star is that it’s a little bit slow to load ( on the app) that’s only when I’m on the same local network; which is something weird. But once I disconnect the WiFi I rightsway notice the difference.

WHAT a great upgrade. I’m impressed with the sound quality. The echo plus 1st gen was ~okay~ for a speaker but this is what I was originally looking for when I bought one last year. If you are thinking of upgrading, just do it. Having the payment plan to eliminate the all at once payment helps too!

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun but not as knowledgeable as I thought
reviews.reviewText: This is a fun item but says, "I don't know" a lot with general knowledge. It's not back up by google, so I still have to google things often . We have fun with the games and ordering from Amazon. Also good for playing music and reminders. With it's faults I still love it. If it were more knowledgable I would give it 5 stars.

We upgraded to the echo 2nd generation because we were really happy with the 1st and wanted better sound in our kitchen. It was pretty easy to connect to all the other Alexa devices we have in the home, and now I can play music throughout the whole house, kind of a cheap Sonus system.

reviews.reviewTitle: Remember to Say 'Alexa' prior to addressing Alexa.
reviews.reviewText: We found Alexa to be very informative and found that she has a sense of humor. She has many talents and we have yet to exhaust them all. Her various games are interesting and challenging. My entire family and people that come to visit always has some comments or questions for Alexa.

I've always been a fan of tech and the Echo Plus and Echo Dot have not dissapointed! Our home is now filled with the music we love, because it's so easy to access. Lights are turned on and off withot a trip across the room, and sprinklers can easily be turned off if it's going to rain. Alexa also reminds me of items on my calendar. With easy access from my cell phone, I love this system!

We like to have positive uplifting music on all day long, and we love playing Air1 Radio on this. We have a big open room for kitchen/dining/family room, and it works great to fill the space. I also love that I can make announcements to the echo dots in our kids bedrooms (in leui of an intercom system).

reviews.reviewTitle: She can't hear me as well as my Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: This one does the job- but I have to speak louder than usual to reach it. I have to speak loud enough that the Echo Dot in the next room hears my requests/questions as well. Sometimes it makes for a good laugh- like when I accidentally set my daughter's alarm for 0330 with my own.

Only works when it wants to.. constantly loses connection or the sound just mutes even though it hasn't been muted with the button. Only remedy is to disconnect and set it back to initial set up to fix it, its a pain in the neck and not worth the hassle. Wish I had tried another hub like google 1st. I don't recommend

The ECHO plus sits on my desk and responds clearly. The speakers sound good for their size. It is compact (of course larger than the Dot) and has connected nicely with my alarm system and smart lights. I also enjoy the "word of the day", jeopardy and other applications. This is a product I highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Too much fluff and not good enough quality sound for the price
reviews.reviewText: I was expecting a much better sound quality for the price m. Don’t bother and buy the Sonos is much better sound quality for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Vastly better sound than the dot and first generation show
reviews.reviewText: I really like the sound coming out of this thing, for a wide variety of music. It replaced a DOT paired with a UE BOOM bluetooth. I had an Apple Homepod for a while - that probably sounded better, but this is 1/3 the cost and isn't tied to the Apple music ecosystem. I'm very happy with this.

I upgraded one Echo, one Echo Plus and two Echo Dots to a pair of Echo Plus (2nd Gen) and a pair of Echo Dots (3rd Gen) and the improvement in music playback is amazing. I am considering adding the Echo Sub to the group, but honestly the Sub may not be required give the great sound quality of these devices.

My son loves his Echo Plus! He turns lights, computer and tv on using it. Changes colors of lights using Alexa. Lol He plays music like crazy. My 5 year old keeps saying”Alexa play Taylor Swift Shake it Off. 200 times a day!!!

Lots of fun at family Christmas for sure!

I really like the sound quality. I listen to podcasts as well as amazon music. The fact that It has an equalizer is really awesome. If I’m listening to music, I can increase the bass, and decrease it for podcasts. Also, it works with my Ring doorbell, so I know when someone’s at my door. All around a really good buy.

reviews.reviewTitle: She is Bluetooth compatible and GREAT sound quality!!👌👌
reviews.reviewText: This product has really good sound quality I can’t even explain it. But I usually use it for my music Bluetooth compatible because I use Apple Music I can tell Alexa next and she will play the next song. Also use it for my lights and TV to turn on and off. Overall so fun to use my first Alexa and don’t regret it still so many things I don’t know about her tho because she can do so much. My friends got one because they saw me use it so much.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product to start building your smart home
reviews.reviewText: This is a great product to start to build your smart home. Works well with Sonos, but only as a way to control their speakers. Alexa will not work in conjunction with Sonos. It is a separate product. More like a traffic cop and a device to get you information.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds great, looks cool, Love Alexa!
reviews.reviewText:
Really good sound, the mic have a wide range so you doesn't have to scream at it when you are far. Looks way better than the 1st gem and color white blend prefect in my living.
Love the Alexa capabilities. Now my kids can play music at the living by themselves.
Now can be set in different languages also a plus with kids in latinamerica.

reviews.reviewTitle: Premium price for not so premium speaker
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the 1st gen Alexa Echo that had all right sound, but most importantly I got it for the Alexa Smart hub. after reading all the advertisement about how the Echo Plus 3rd gen had premium sound and it was a much better speaker I Purchased it. I was very disappointed at the sound it did not sound any better than my 1st Gen Echo the only thing that actually the only thing that impressed me was that the echo plus 3rd gen had more language options particularly Spanish. for almost the same price you can purchase a Sonos One Smart Speaker that was 10 time better sound

reviews.reviewTitle: It connects with all our devices
reviews.reviewText: Like that it connects to all our devices. We have iPhones and Google didn’t play nice with Apple so we returned Google and purchased the Echo Plus. It was easy to connect, control and plays nice with Apple. I can play any music I have on iTunes which is a huge bonus.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you’re skeptical, just buy it!
reviews.reviewText: I honestly was super skeptical when buying the echo plus. I’m an Apple person through and through and was going to stick it out until I could afford a HomePod. However, I’m so glad I didn’t wait! I just got my Echo Plus on Monday so I haven’t had it very long but I already absolutely love it! There is still so much for me to figure out and what not but I feel like that just makes it more fun! The sound quality is great and Alexa's intercession is flawless. The amount of information you can get with just your voice is outstanding. If you’re skeptical about buying this don’t be, just got for it! You won’t be disappointed.

Love it! My boyfriend somehow blew the speakers out on our amazon dot so we decided to get this one! Much better voice recognition and the sound quality! We are able to have the “guard” option and I believe if we have more options to integrate things! Worth it!
The sound produced it quite good given the units size. Voice recognition is superb and connectivity to external speakers very accurate.

reviews.reviewTitle: The sound is great but has a terrible bluetooth latency problem and through AUX Audio
reviews.reviewText:
There is an audio delay (about 0.5 sec) when Echo Plus is connected via Bluetooth to Fire TV 4k. The audio sync is lost every time the video is paused. There is no such problem when Fire TV 4k is connected to my 1st generation Echo. I bought this speaker to use it with my tv, but it is basically useless now.

The audio delay is also present when Echo Plus is connected to iMac through Bluetooth and AUX Audio line in as well.

The quality of sound is great though.

Is very convenient, is very smart if you spend some time in the configuration really makes your life easy. Before buying I was hesitating to buy it because I did not understand its capabilities. But now that I have it is amazing how you can take advantage of alexa for your daily routine

reviews.reviewTitle: I still like my original Echo better
reviews.reviewText:
It's slow to respond, when it does respond. Mic is to sensitive for the location. If there is music playing I have to scream at it. There is occasional "pops" from the Audio.
Update: Despite my issues with this new "Echo" it's better than 2 but still not a solid 4.

Like these so much I have duel + Bass in my living area. Added smart switches to the fans and smart bulbs throughout the house every room has an Echo device makes my home SMART. Love being able to see what is ON while I'm away and able to shut off those I forgot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound quality is nice but the Volume control is ridiculous and voice response is poor
reviews.reviewText:
Volume Control WTF?
as soon as I paired the sub I lost the ability to control the Volume and the Voice control sucks
My advice buy a nice stereo and plug it into a Dot
You will have a better system

I bought this item because my original 1st generation Alexa quit connecting to my internet, don't know where the product failed or my internet provider quit recognizing the product. This replacement model works very well and recognizes all my wireless products that were connected to my original Alexa.

I am learning more about this device everyday. What I use it mostly for is listening to my favorite radio stations from far away and locally. For an itty, bitty, teeny, tiny device, music comes out booming on this thing! I like creating my weekly shopping lists and reminders.

My Echo Plus rocks!

These echos really save time. Just acting to take reminder notes is great. That's not to mention using the music, communication to other rooms in the house, etc. I'll buy a couple of more in the future. But then Amazon could surprise me with one 😀.

We listen to a lot more music now since it's so easy to start turn off, select music, browse, etc. We have hooked it up to only 1 light and that's nice. Use it for Spanish word of the day as well. We have plans to learn more about it, but it is still new, but good enough that it is already worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: I am So much lazier now and I love it!
reviews.reviewText: I am so much lazier now than I ever imagined! I don't even have to lift my 6oz cell phone to look something up! This thing does it all for me! Amazing sound quality, voice recognition is incredible, it is small. Good job Jeff Bezos - some day you may be a rich man.

Bought this as a surprise birthday gift for my hard to please wife; she loves it. Sounds much better than the Dot, even the newest version. We haven't even played with the smart hub stuff. Looks good too, though I expect it be a dust magnet.
Alexa is totally incredible. My Echo Plus works flawlessly. Still amazed every day about all the things Alexa can do and finding new things daily.

I swear my husband got me an Alexa to hear me fight, I have a very think accent so sometimes I tell her something and Alexa answer with a completely out of the subject answer 🤣🤣 I do have fun with it, I do wish I could have more options for name and that she could fight back from time to time 🤣🤣

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound but software not quite 100%
reviews.reviewText: Love it, but stereo capabilities are still a bit flakey. One speaker will ocassionally unpair.

This Echo Plus is a great device. At night it plays rain sounds to sleep by, in the morning it tells you a joke to make your day brighter. It will read you anything from Wikipedia. It has full internet access, keeps timers, sets alarms, tells you the weather. When combined with Amazon Cloudcam it even helps with security. I’ve since bought one for every room in my house.

Sent it back when a news report reported
Alexa records conversations..."says" info goes to the cloud for marketing purposes.
Really? No thanks....

Pros:
- Sound quality
- Setup
- Alexa

Cons:
- This is more of an Alex con... while it allows you to connect to Spotify, the options are very limited.
- About 20-25% Alexa can't recognize what I'm saying.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon should provide more complete information on Alexa's capabilities
reviews.reviewText: For the most part, My Echo + and Alexa have been great. I originally got my Echo + for playing music, but slowly discovered that she could do much more, but wish that Amazon would have a better way to discover all the features. Alexa could use improvement on the voice recognition (you have to speak clearly or she goes on the wrong path) but overall she is great. The sound is fine when playing music, but I left for a business trip and a week later she had forgotten my music, so I had to teach her all over again... Amazon did get me to join Amazon Music, as some of the songs that I like were not in the free music.

For years I thought, "why would anyone want or need an Alexa?" I was wrong! How did I live without her all this time? She is awesome! I love that I can ask her to play any random song or ask her any question. I am still learning all the skills that I can enable. I highly recommend an Alexa! I am addicted now!

I got this Echo Plus as a trial run into the smart home game, and I have to say I am nothing but impressed with it. I would have paid 60-70 bucks for the speaker alone. Pair that with Amazon Alexa, and a built in Zigbee hub? This device is an amazing value for what you get. Once they get the subwoofer sorted with working for content that isn't streamed and with the fire tv, I'm buying another one or two and a sub or two.

I should probably add, within a week of owning this my girlfriend bought two echo dots to put around our house. Needless to say, we are pretty hooked.

I plan to utilize the SmartHub feature on this device, but I haven't purchased any of the products. However, the sound coming from this device is superior to the Generation 1 Echo. I may return to update the rating once I have the other devices leveraging the smart hub in the Echo Plus device.

Functionality is fine. I have a Bose equivalent and I have the Alexa app on my phone ties to a portable bluetooth speaker. Sound quality on either alternative is a vastly superior choice. Love Alexa. Wasted my money on the echo plus.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Gift that keeps on giving
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Plus (2nd Gen) not only sounds great, but the bass is great as well. It is seriously comparable to JBL's Charge 3 with the echo plus having more bass it feels like. Aside from the audio portion of it, the texture of the speaker is a nice soft material and feels expensive. The down side would be the Alexa app on the phone but that's more-so the app and not the speaker. Worth the buy.

I'm writing this review for the Echo Plus But I didn't get them from Amazon.. I bought 2 from Staples,, they had a sale buy 1 get a $100.00 off on a second one.. So I have them paired in the family room .. great stereo sound.. and I also have the 3rd gen echo dot in the bedroom.. all working awesome

We added this in our living room after using a 2gen EchoShow in the kitchen and a dot in the bedroom. It really completes the experience. We love the multi room music setup so our tunes are everywhere when doing housework. Also, we're controlling a lot of our lighting with our Echo devices. I'm loving it.

The sound quality is a lot better with the plus than the base echo or show. Very satisfied. I also got the battery base so we take this outside to the pool area. One plus puts out enough good sound for the entire outside area. It is not waterproof! We keep it on a table but it still is plenty loud for entertaining.

There has been times where a command has to be restated a few times but over all no one has stopped using it as well as they are rather happy with it at times. Over time and as the unit learn the voice of a person it does get better.

In love!!!!!! I start my morning by myself getting the house ready for everyone to wake up so I listen to alexa giving me a morning run down. I add it to my phone so I can play my videos and music over it. You can unplug it and take it into different rooms without having to reset anything. Great great purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: linking the Echo to devices around the house
reviews.reviewText: I first wanted the Echo to link my lights, thermostat, alarm system and music to one device. After purchasing the Echo Plus there are some things that are easy to link and others that are more difficult. If you thinking of make your home a smart home you're better off not relying on the Echo as a hub as it will limit what devices you can use without an additional hub.

Have to pay twice for Amazon music. Why doesn’t it link to my other Echo? Can’t understand compound words very well. Ask it to play “Beat Me Daddy 8 to the Bar” and she say can’t find any music bar. What? Asks her to play “Royal Station” by Melissa Etheridge and she say here’s a Royal Station you might like. Pretty bad

I like the sound quality. Not love. It’s food for a small radio sound quality. It’s no boss but it’s veey nice I have it in my garage and it sounds great in there. Mostly because of acoustics. I’m thinking of adding the sub. It’s better then the small Alexa but. Or as good as a full stereo. Hope that helps. PS I love the Alexa features in the garage. Nice to have it remember things for you

We had friends over for dinner one night who said they could not hear my music in our dining room so they sent me the Echo Plus. All I can say is, amazing. I synched it to my Pandora account and my iPod which was very easy and I am also using it with Amazon music.
I love it!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Helps if you are Tech Savvy but not required
reviews.reviewText: It helps if you are tech savvy but definitely required. I was able to install this device and hook up smart plugs to control my TV and an Echo Dot in the Master Bedroom. Just don't have a house full yelling at Alexa at the same time - that's just aggravating.

Not worth it! Just get a portable speaker that allows anyone to tap into it with blue tooth. Only your specific devices you set up through an app works. It’s limited, the voice recognition is pretty good and you must plug in to work so not convenient to go out places.

This was a gift for my wife and she loved it. I gotta admit I also enjoy it. Great quality sound for such a small speaker and the voice recognition was spot on. Integrating to my already set up Smartthings was a breeze so I have nothing but good things to say about this device.

There are a lot of questions Alexa either doesn't know the answer to or answer correctly. I've heard from friends who have both an echo and a google home that if you want an actual answer Google is better and alexa is more for fun. I'd like the best of both, please. Otherwise the sounds quality on this is surprisingly good.

For it costing a 100 $ more than an alexa it is not worthy, I currently have this echo plus and a echo dot, I’m a huge fan of speakers and have own several, right now I have also a jbl flip 4 and if you are buying this product for sound quality it is greatly disappointing, I thought at first it was damaged, I mean, the bass quality is acceptable but the sound integration with mids and high is plain awful. The thing I really gotta accept is that the sound is really penetrating and somehow you can listen it clearly from various parts of your house.

Haven't had this device for long and haven't explored many of the information Alexa can provide. What I have requested of her have been promptly answered and I have no complaints.
Alexa always has an entertaining quip if you greet her good morning and/or good night!
Voice recognition is superb and the setup was easy. So far Echo Plus (2nd Gen) rates a 5 Star!
I am not what I deem a tech savvy person but this was so easy to set up and figure out! I love it so much that I purchased another for my makeup room. Great!!

Family is really enjoying Alexa! Not a sound guru, but we think it sounds great! So nice to be able to ask so many questions on the fly and the Amazon Music is great. Yes, sometimes its unclear why Alexa cannot answer something. I've added several lights around the home and enjoy being able to turn lights on and off through Alexa. The colored lights are a fun twist too. I can foresee adding features and connectivity in the future.

I am recently widowed, and decided I needed some noise in an otherwise very quiet house. Alexa greets me and tells me the trivia of the day when I greet her, and she tells me good night when I go off to bed. And she plays music the rest of the day. I'm pleased to have Alexa in my house.

the echo plus sounds great. I am amazed at how well it identifies spoken commands. still learning all it can do. just controlling some lights right now, and playing some music, which is wonderful. took a while learning how to get it to integrate two different light zones together..

reviews.reviewTitle: Device doesn’t compare to the 1st generation
reviews.reviewText: I hope someone from Amazon contacts me. This is the worst purchase. I had a first generation and loved it. The sound isn’t as loud, the blue tooth connectivity isn’t as good and voice recognition is very crappy. I already have my first generation to my mom. Very disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Two echo plusses with an echo sub.
reviews.reviewText:
A joy to listen to. I use it more than my giant old hifi stereo that costed a lot more. Amazon and iheart radio have stations that an old fart like me can appreciate. They seem to be gone from conventional radio.
I love the music that I can get now, and I love the sound quality.

After searching the comments from other owners of this product I am having the same problem.
While playing a radio station it just stops playing while another echo in the other room still continues to play.
Please give a proper fix. It isn't the router as the other echo on the same router continues to play.

I'm enjoying the Echo Plus for playing music. Depending on the day, I love exploring new music and revisiting the classics by voice command. The sound quality is perfect for playing in the family room. I'm starting to pay more attention to the emails showing what's new with Alexa, but mostly interested in music and general questions . . . trying to keep positive by staying away from depressing news reports.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa's understanding of speech and interpretation are exceptional.
reviews.reviewText: I was very impressed with the utility of the Alexa function. I purchased the device for evaluation and was soon converted to a believer in the concept. It does more than turn lights on and off but also anticipates actions that might be useful, like announcing the delivery of an Amazon shipment and the ease of use as a radio replacement. The interface is intuitive and seems to be very helpful on setup and in the use of the skills, like suggesting alternatives when the night sounds skill was selected. The suggestive guidance is helpful when a new skill is being used.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy set-up, voice recognition is good -2 people - sound quality is o.k.
reviews.reviewText: The echo is fun and interesting, just learning things that can be done with it. Mostly playing music & findinging out about the weather forecast. We are interested n these devices to find out what's up in the ubiquitous discussion of 'AI". So far it's early days and still much to learn.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good all around controller and information provider.
reviews.reviewText: I have been happy with the Echo Plus. It is my first experience with Alexa and it seems to work pretty well.
